                    <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="1249003E" w14:textId="77777777">
                        <w:r>
                            <w:t>Clarified the letter requirements for ‘Who may be the principal investigator for Human Research?’ to include Center Director; Clarified exception to protocol WORD version requirement, including process guidance; Added data security guidance provided by University Information Security; Added Gillette Children’s Specialty Healthcare Scientific Review as an acceptable method for scientific assessment; clarified exempt vs. non-exempt translation/certification requirements; clarified meaning of enrollment for continuing review submissions; removed ‘Review Fee for Business- and Industry-Sponsored Projects Reviewed by Quorum IRB’</w:t>
                        </w:r>
                    </w:p>
                </w:tc>
            </w:tr>
            <w:tr w:rsidR="00B12638" w14:paraId="0C686C3E" w14:textId="77777777">

                <w:tc>
                    <w:tcPr>
                        <w:tcW w:w="4202" w:type="dxa"/>
                    </w:tcPr>
                    <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidP="00124C66" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="1D8DBAFB" w14:textId="77777777">
                        <w:r>
                            <w:t xml:space="preserve">Added “HRP-574: Certification Attestation of Translation” template reference and guidance for use for studies requiring certification of translated study materials; Added additional guidance related to IRB’s role in the receipt of sponsor communications such as Medical Device Reports to the RNI section; Clarified University requirements for consent template language for studies where the sponsor has developed the consent document; Updated Toolkit reference for the External Team Member form from HRP-212 to HRP-216. </w:t>
                        </w:r>
                    </w:p>
                </w:tc>
            </w:tr>
        </w:tbl>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00B12638" w14:paraId="136A221A" w14:textId="77777777"/>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B55462" w:rsidRDefault="00B55462" w14:paraId="0E8653F7" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:rFonts w:ascii="Arial" w:hAnsi="Arial" w:eastAsia="Arial" w:cs="Arial"/>

            <w:r>
                <w:br w:type="page"/>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="69AAF012" w14:textId="61658403">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:pStyle w:val="Heading1"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>What is the purpose of this manual?</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="5"/>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="5DC8DE52" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>The “INVESTIGATOR MANUAL (HRP-103)” is designed to guide you through policies, procedures, and resources related to the conduct of Human Research that are specific to the University of Minnesota (“University”).</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="7E05CC52" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">Along with this manual, current Human Research-related policies, SOPs, Worksheets, Checklists and templates may be found in the </w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:hyperlink r:id="rId15">
                <w:r>
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>HRPP Toolkit Library</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">.  Collectively, the Toolkit Library creates a complete picture of Human Research Protection Program (“HRPP”) and Institutional Review Board (“IRB”) expectations and a guide to seeking IRB review and approval.  The Toolkit is also used by HRPP staff and IRB members to enhance compliance with federal, state and local requirements for conducting research and protecting human participants. </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="3F7C7281" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>As you read through this manual and supporting documents, you may find the definitions and descriptions in “SOP: Definitions (HRP-001)” particularly helpful.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="24419D80" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">The University has implemented (in March 2017) the Ethical Oversight Submission System (ETHOS), a web-based platform for IRB submissions and HRPP oversight.  Information about this system can be found on the </w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:hyperlink r:id="rId16">
                <w:r>
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>ETHOS</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
            <w:r>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:color w:val="070707"/>
                </w:rPr>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve"> </w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">web page; job aides for use of the system can be found on the </w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:hyperlink r:id="rId17">
                <w:r>
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>Training and Resources</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
            <w:r>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:color w:val="070707"/>
                </w:rPr>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve"> </w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>web page.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="0443FACA" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>To ensure you are always referencing the most current version of Toolkit and related documents, please access them in real time from the IRB website rather than downloading and storing them on your computer.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="3EF8CF34" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>We encourage you to use all of these resources to aid in the successful submission and conduct of your research study.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="007C04DF" w14:paraId="6A31E417" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:hyperlink w:anchor="1fob9te">
                <w:r w:rsidR="00124C66">
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>Return to Table of Contents</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="17083D45" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:rFonts w:ascii="Arial" w:hAnsi="Arial" w:eastAsia="Arial" w:cs="Arial"/>
                    <w:b/>
                    <w:sz w:val="32"/>
                    <w:szCs w:val="32"/>
                </w:rPr>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:br w:type="page"/>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="32233DA9" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:pStyle w:val="Heading1"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_Toc518040958" w:id="6"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Conducting Human Research at the University of Minnesota</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="6"/>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="0D013BB6" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:pStyle w:val="Heading2"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_Toc518040959" w:id="7"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>What is Human Research?</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="7"/>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="035C7B41" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>The “HUMAN RESEARCH PROTECTION PROGRAM PLAN (HRP-101)” defines the activities that the University considers to be “Human Research.” An algorithm for determining whether an activity is Human Research can be found in the “WORKSHEET: Human Research (HRP-310)”. Use this document for guidance as to whether an activity meets either the Department of Health and Human Services (“DHHS”) or Food and Drug Association (“FDA”) definition of Human Research, keeping in mind that the IRB makes the ultimate determination in questionable cases as to whether an activity constitutes Human Research subject to IRB oversight.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="0DF120B1" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>With respect to research activity at the University:</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="767FE2FD" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="1"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:strike/>
                </w:rPr>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>You are responsible for following all IRB requirements for Human Research;</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="2334090F" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="1"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:strike/>
                </w:rPr>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>You may not conduct Human Research without prior IRB review and approval.  The IRB will not review or approve research activity that has already occurred.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="1E4C55C0" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="1"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:strike/>
                </w:rPr>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>If you have questions about whether an activity is Human Research, see HRP-503 “Human Research Determination Form”;</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="71825D4C" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="1"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>See “WORKSHEET: Exemption Determination (HRP-312)” for activities that are exempt from IRB oversight.  Note that you must still submit the study to the IRB for review and an exempt determination; and</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="31420F71" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="1"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Human Research may be reviewed and approved by an external IRB in certain situations.  See the section of this manual titled “What if I want to rely on an external IRB for review of my study?” for questions regarding study eligibility and process.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="007C04DF" w14:paraId="4E572C01" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:hyperlink w:anchor="1fob9te">
                <w:r w:rsidR="00124C66">
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>Return to Table of Contents</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="014006EC" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:pStyle w:val="Heading2"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_Toc518040960" w:id="8"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>What is the Human Research Protection Program (HRPP)?</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="8"/>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="10563612" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>The “</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:hyperlink r:id="rId18">
                <w:r>
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>HUMAN RESEARCH PROTECTION PROGRAM PLAN (HRP-101)</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>” describes the University’s overall plan to protect participants in Human Research.  It includes:</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="56651C11" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="46"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>The mission of the Human Research Protection Program;</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="7FF2A11C" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="46"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>The ethical principles that the University follows governing the conduct of Human Research;</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="1A1BAB1B" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="46"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">The applicable laws that govern Human Research (see also </w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:hyperlink r:id="rId19">
                <w:r>
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>HRP-112 for Minnesota laws</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>);</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="327FEF12" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="46"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>When the University becomes “engaged in Human Research” and when someone is acting as an agent of the University conducting Human Research;</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="71034B38" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="46"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>The types of Human Research that may not be conducted; and</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="2669A0B3" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="46"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>The roles and responsibilities of individuals within the University.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="3D46C885" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
                <w:ind w:left="720" w:hanging="360"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">Visit the </w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:hyperlink r:id="rId20">
                <w:r>
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>Human Research Protection Program website</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve"> to learn more about the HRPP.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="007C04DF" w14:paraId="5F8779D2" w14:textId="77777777">

                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:hyperlink w:anchor="1fob9te">
                <w:r w:rsidR="00124C66">

            </w:hyperlink>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="6B594F85" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:pStyle w:val="Heading2"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_Toc518040961" w:id="9"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Who may be the principal investigator for Human Research?</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="9"/>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="5C4C802D" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Every research study requires a Principal Investigator (PI). This person takes full responsibility for the conduct of the study. Below is a list of who may and may not serve as PI on submissions to the IRB, though unique circumstances (e.g., requests from staff) may be given special consideration. These requirements are applied to submissions received by the IRB but do not extend institution-wide.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="007C04DF" w14:paraId="7DDE16AF" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:hyperlink w:anchor="1fob9te">
                <w:r w:rsidR="00124C66">
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>Return to Table of Contents</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>

                <w:t>Fairview Affiliated</w:t>

            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Fairview employee;</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="346C68E2" w14:textId="77777777">

                <w:numPr>

            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Non-University employee with Fairview medical staff privileges;</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="3E006D0F" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="20"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:line="259" w:lineRule="auto"/>
                <w:contextualSpacing/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Persons with another affiliation with Fairview subject to Fairview authority and who is using Fairview facilities, Fairview patients in their capacity as Fairview patients, or other Fairview resources.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="3164B2D0" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">Fairview will institute a process whereby non-University investigators involved in research obtain from Fairview confirmation of their status as a Fairview employee or other Fairview affiliated researchers subject to Fairview authority. Upload your confirmation into the “Supporting Documents” section in your ETHOS submission.  Contact Fairview Research Administration at </w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:hyperlink r:id="rId22">
                <w:r>
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>Research@Fairview.org</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve"> to request PI approval.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="7F2CB1A5" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:pStyle w:val="Heading3"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_3rdcrjn" w:colFirst="0" w:colLast="0" w:id="14"/>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_Toc518040964" w:id="15"/>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="14"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Gillette Affiliated</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="15"/>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="70A81035" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">The Principal Investigator (PI) is a Gillette employed or contracted individual designated by an institution to have the appropriate level of authority and responsibility to direct a research activity. A PI must be qualified by education, training and experience in the area in which the research is being conducted. </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="7A82B876" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">Contact Joyce Trost via </w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:hyperlink r:id="rId23">
                <w:r>
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>Research@gillettechildrens.com</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">  to request PI approval for your study at the same time as you request Scientific Review. Please include your CV and a copy of your protocol. </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="03EB86C6" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">If approval is granted, confirmation of PI approval will be included in a letter that will also include scientific review approval. Upload the approval letter into the “Supporting Documents” section in your ETHOS submission. </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="7D9E0FCD" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:pStyle w:val="Heading3"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_26in1rg" w:colFirst="0" w:colLast="0" w:id="16"/>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_Toc518040965" w:id="17"/>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="16"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>UMP Affiliated</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="17"/>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="33D11C51" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">In order to serve as a principal investigator on a UMN human research study, the UMP physician must also hold a faculty appointment at the University of Minnesota. Under this dual-appointment, the physician must adhere to responsibilities, including but not limited to, those described in the </w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:hyperlink r:id="rId24">
                <w:r>
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="1155CC"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>UMP agreement</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>, University’s HRPP Manual (HRP-101) and Investigator Manual (HRP-103). The University PI is responsible for assuring that all members of the research team, including UMP employees, comply with all laws, regulations, standards and requirements that govern research studies and clinical trials.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="007C04DF" w14:paraId="7838182E" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:hyperlink w:anchor="1fob9te">
                <w:r w:rsidR="00124C66">
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>Return to Table of Contents</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="1B0484DD" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:pStyle w:val="Heading2"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_Toc518040966" w:id="18"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>How do I transfer responsibility to a new principal investigator?</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="18"/>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00B12638" w14:paraId="1769D859" w14:textId="77777777"/>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="529D7B70" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">Changes of PI often prompt changes to other parts of the study.  Review all consent/assent forms, recruitment materials and other documents to make certain they have been updated to reflect the change.  The current PI may transfer responsibility to a new PI by creating a Modification in ETHOS and selecting “Other parts of the study” as the modification scopte.  This will “unlock” the section of the application that will allow you to update the PI and any other related study materials.  The current PI must submit the modification.  The new PI will be able to submit after the modification has been review and approved by the IRB.   </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="7E955EDC" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:pStyle w:val="Heading2"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_Toc518040967" w:id="19"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>What happens if the principal investigator abruptly goes on leave or departs the institution without transferring responsibility for his or her studies?</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="19"/>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="436522B2" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">Not all transitions can be anticipated.  If a PI goes on an unanticipated leave or there is an abrupt departure from the University or one of our affiliated institutions, follow the steps below to request changing the PI.  </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="19F0DB69" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="6"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:contextualSpacing/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">The department head/division chief prepares a letter on official letterhead to the IRB explaining the circumstances of the leave, identifying the current PI and study number, and naming the new PI.  </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="481E0F54" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="6"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:contextualSpacing/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">A current member of the study team prepares the modification in ETHOS to change the PI and update, as needed, any study documents (see job aid “How to submit a modification” for detailed instructions).  A study team member will be able to complete all necessary steps except submitting to the IRB. </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="443EEE98" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="6"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:contextualSpacing/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">Email the IRB at </w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:hyperlink r:id="rId25">
                <w:r>
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="1155CC"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>irb@umn.edu</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>.  The email must include the Modification number associated with the request to change PI and the letter from the department head.   Once the request is received, IRB staff will submit the Modification on the behalf of the new PI for review. IRB staff will add a comment in the system to notify the Primary Contact that the modification was submitted. If the study does not include additional staff members or a primary contact, please contact the IRB. Please note that this process is only for use when the PI’s departure is both sudden and unanticipated.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="007C04DF" w14:paraId="3D541855" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:hyperlink w:anchor="1fob9te">
                <w:r w:rsidR="00124C66">
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>Return to Table of Contents</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="5E3649EC" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:pStyle w:val="Heading2"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_Toc518040968" w:id="20"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>What if I’m a Student-Investigator?</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="20"/>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="63BEC2CA" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:color w:val="070707"/>
                </w:rPr>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:highlight w:val="white"/>
                </w:rPr>
                <w:t>In order to ensure adequate oversight of student-led research, your advisor is required to submit your IRB application and any subsequent changes made to that application. You have the ability to create a study in ETHOS.  You must assign your advisor to the PI/Advisor role in the ETHOS SmartForm for it to be submitted for review.</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve"> For information about submitting your study, refer to the </w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:hyperlink r:id="rId26">
                <w:r>
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>ETHOS Guide for Students and Advisors</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
            <w:r>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:color w:val="070707"/>
                </w:rPr>
                <w:t>.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="007C04DF" w14:paraId="2843BA58" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:color w:val="070707"/>
                </w:rPr>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:hyperlink w:anchor="1fob9te">
                <w:r w:rsidR="00124C66">
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>Return to Table of Contents</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="49507837" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:pStyle w:val="Heading3"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_44sinio" w:colFirst="0" w:colLast="0" w:id="21"/>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_Toc518040969" w:id="22"/>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="21"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Advisor Role &amp; Responsibilities</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="22"/>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="2F20C34D" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">As an advisor, you are ultimately responsible for the conduct of research initiated by your student-advisee. To serve as an PI/Advisor on a student submission, you must meet the eligibility requirements of a principal investigator (See </w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:r>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:i/>
                </w:rPr>
                <w:t>Who may be a principal investigator?</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">). </w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:r>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:highlight w:val="white"/>
                </w:rPr>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">In submitting the study in ETHOS, </w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>you assure the IRB of the following:</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="16F13B57" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="54"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>You will assume the responsibilities required to oversee the conduct of the research, prevent harms and foster benefit to participants;</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="3F7E2E54" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="54"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Any changes in the research project, adverse events, or incidents which may affect the conduct of research will be reported to the IRB;</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="66C42F6B" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="54"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>You have thoroughly reviewed the proposed research study;</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="0F5C1316" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="54"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">The topic and design of the study are appropriate for student research; </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="5A54E618" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="54"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>The student-investigator has the necessary experience and training to conduct the research;</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="060BFBEB" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="54"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>You will meet with the student-investigator on a regular basis to monitor study progress;  If the study procedures are carried out in a location away from the University or regular channels of communication are not feasible, you will make alternate arrangements to continue communication with the student-investigator;</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="14CC07A4" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="54"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>The student-investigator will promptly report, and you will submit, unanticipated problems to the IRB;</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="724DEAED" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="54"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>The student-investigator will adhere to all requirements for continuing review;</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="323A89D3" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="54"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>If the student-investigator leaves the University, you will provide all necessary documents for terminating the study or continuing review; and</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="0AC623B8" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="54"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>If you will be unavailable, you will arrange for an alternate faculty advisor to assume the above responsibilities, and will advise the IRB of this change.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="007C04DF" w14:paraId="6E5508EE" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:hyperlink w:anchor="1fob9te">
                <w:r w:rsidR="00124C66">
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>Return to Table of Contents</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="4F44906A" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:pStyle w:val="Heading2"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_Toc518040970" w:id="23"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>What training is required to conduct Human Research?</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="23"/>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="14651963" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Training requirements are described in “SOP: Human Research Education and Training (HRP-066).” All members of the research team listed on an IRB submission classified as exempt or non-exempt research, must complete the required training. Although recommended, research team members listed on submissions determined “Not Human Research” will not be required to complete the IRB training requirements.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="058BAD81" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">All members of the research team involved in the design, conduct, or reporting of the research must complete training. Members of the research team who have not completed human research protections training may not take part in aspects of the research that involve human subjects. All required training must be completed before IRB final approval can be granted. Instructions on how to complete the training requirements can be found on the </w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:hyperlink r:id="rId27">
                <w:r>
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>Training section</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve"> of the IRB website.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="5A8BECBA" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:pStyle w:val="Heading3"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_z337ya" w:colFirst="0" w:colLast="0" w:id="24"/>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_Toc518040971" w:id="25"/>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="24"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Fairview Affiliated</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="25"/>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="4505849F" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Fairview employees listed as research staff or principal investigator on a UMN human research study, must comply with UMN IRB training requirements as described in “SOP: Human Research Education and Training (HRP-066).” Fairview Research Administration will confirm training completions outside of UMN offerings, including Fairview’s HIPAA training.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="7FBD948F" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:pStyle w:val="Heading3"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_3j2qqm3" w:colFirst="0" w:colLast="0" w:id="26"/>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_Toc518040972" w:id="27"/>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="26"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Gillette Affiliated</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="27"/>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="26F9391F" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Gillette employees listed as research staff or principal investigator on a UMN human research study, must comply with UMN IRB training requirements as described in “SOP: Human Research Education and Training (HRP-066).” Gillette will confirm training completions outside of UMN offerings, including Gillette’s HIPAA training.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="421127D0" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:pStyle w:val="Heading3"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_1y810tw" w:colFirst="0" w:colLast="0" w:id="28"/>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_Toc518040973" w:id="29"/>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="28"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>UMP Affiliated</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="29"/>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="27313054" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">UMP employees, other than physicians, listed as research staff or principal investigator on a UMN human research study, must comply with UMN IRB training requirements as described in “SOP: Human Research Education and Training (HRP-066)” including the University’s HIPAA training, HIPAA16, available in </w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:hyperlink r:id="rId28">
                <w:r>
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="1155CC"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>ULearn</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve"> per the </w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:hyperlink r:id="rId29">
                <w:r>
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="1155CC"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>UMP agreement</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00B12638" w14:paraId="2517D139" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="007C04DF" w14:paraId="1DC22EDB" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:hyperlink w:anchor="1fob9te">
                <w:r w:rsidR="00124C66">
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>Return to Table of Contents</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="3D8C5569" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:pStyle w:val="Heading2"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_Toc518040974" w:id="30"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>How do investigators and other study personnel disclose potential conflicts of interest?</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="30"/>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="4BB56C6B" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Investigators and study personnel working with human participants must follow their home institution’s policies and procedures for reporting and management of potential conflicts of interest.  The IRB will make the ultimate determination as to if and how a conflict of interest can be managed to protect participants in the research.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="0A0D2575" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>The existence of financial and/or business interests related to the research study must be disclosed in the New Study and Continuing Review forms in ETHOS for all study personnel.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="3562B227" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>All conflicts and should be reported and resolved prior to submission to the IRB.  Unresolved conflict of interest disclosures will result in a HOLD being placed on new study submissions; review will not occur until a determination is received from the applicable oversight body above.  You should upload the determination and any management plan in the Supporting Documents section of ETHOS.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="265941EF" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>The conflict determination and/or management plan will be reviewed by the convened IRB or assigned designated reviewer, depending upon the level of review required for the study.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="007C04DF" w14:paraId="49433767" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:hyperlink w:anchor="1fob9te">
                <w:r w:rsidR="00124C66">
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>Return to Table of Contents</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="32B1527F" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:pStyle w:val="Heading3"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_2xcytpi" w:colFirst="0" w:colLast="0" w:id="31"/>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_Toc518040975" w:id="32"/>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="31"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Individual Conflicts of Interest - University of Minnesota Affiliated</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="32"/>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="57B69113" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">For University investigators, you must disclose all reportable conflicts to the University’s </w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:hyperlink r:id="rId30">
                <w:r>
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>Office of Institutional Compliance</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve"> (OIC).</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="11E875EC" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">In January 2018, the University of Minnesota adopted a new financial interest policy, titled “Individual Conflict of Interest and Standards Governing Relationships with Business Entities. See </w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:hyperlink r:id="rId31">
                <w:r>
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="1155CC"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>https://policy.umn.edu/operations/conflictinterest</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve"> for policy details. You are responsible for understanding and complying with the new policy. </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="1E00A76B" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">For questions, contact Jon Guden, Associate Director of the Conflict of Interest Program, at </w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:hyperlink r:id="rId32">
                <w:r>
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>jguden@umn.edu</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>, or (612) 626-4727.</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:hyperlink w:anchor="1fob9te">
                <w:r>
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>Return to Table of Contents</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="1A236EB1" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:pStyle w:val="Heading3"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_1ci93xb" w:colFirst="0" w:colLast="0" w:id="33"/>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_Toc518040976" w:id="34"/>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="33"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Individual Conflicts of Interest - Fairview Affiliated</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="34"/>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="5C5A4654" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>For Fairview investigators, conflict of interest disclosures are initially due prior to federal grant or IRB submission, and renewed by the first of each year. Disclosures must be updated at the time of change in institutional responsibilities or financial or business interests as well.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="007C04DF" w14:paraId="0E48F00B" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:hyperlink w:anchor="1fob9te">
                <w:r w:rsidR="00124C66">
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>Return to Table of Contents</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="1F2D7C36" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:pStyle w:val="Heading3"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_3whwml4" w:colFirst="0" w:colLast="0" w:id="35"/>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_Toc518040977" w:id="36"/>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="35"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Individual Conflicts of Interest - Gillette Affiliated</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="36"/>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="2F02EF85" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Gillette investigators must report any or all significant financial interests through completing a Financial Disclosure for Research Form (or similar form) at the start of their research involvement at Gillette Children’s and then annually thereafter and submit to Research Administration. If they, their spouse or domestic partner, or dependent children have consulting arrangements, significant financial interests, or employment in an outside entity as described above, that may affect the research endeavor that they will be pursuing, then a management plan must be created by the Research Committee or designated subcommittee. Common sense must prevail in the interpretation of these provisions. That is, if a reasonable person would question the relationship, it should be disclosed and approval sought for the proposed arrangement.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="007C04DF" w14:paraId="1EAB9B3C" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:hyperlink w:anchor="1fob9te">
                <w:r w:rsidR="00124C66">
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>Return to Table of Contents</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="386EFF13" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:pStyle w:val="Heading3"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_2bn6wsx" w:colFirst="0" w:colLast="0" w:id="37"/>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_Toc518040978" w:id="38"/>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="37"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Institutional Conflicts of Interest</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="38"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve"> </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="153C512C" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>The potential for institutional conflict of interest exists where the University has a significant financial interest in the research under review.  These situations are generally handled in the same manner as potential individual conflicts of interest.  You must provide the IRB with any determination or management plan prior to review (for new studies) or once received for ongoing studies.  The IRB will review the information and make a final determination as to if and how the conflict of interest can be managed to protect participants in the research.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="007C04DF" w14:paraId="4602D396" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:rFonts w:ascii="Arial" w:hAnsi="Arial" w:eastAsia="Arial" w:cs="Arial"/>
                    <w:b/>
                    <w:sz w:val="32"/>
                    <w:szCs w:val="32"/>
                </w:rPr>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:hyperlink w:anchor="1fob9te">
                <w:r w:rsidR="00124C66">
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>Return to Table of Contents</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="757BE9B8" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:pStyle w:val="Heading1"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_Toc518040979" w:id="39"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Submitting Your Study for Review</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="39"/>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="2DC23BF2" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:pStyle w:val="Heading2"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_Toc518040980" w:id="40"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>What if I’m not sure my project requires IRB review?</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="40"/>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="0F826F62" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">The IRB reviews all activities that meet the federal definition of human research.  If you are unsure if your proposed project meets that definition, refer to the “WORKSHEET: Human Research (HRP-310)” for guidance.  </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="19F7CC7C" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>If you remain unsure about whether your project qualifies as human research or you desire documentation of the determination, you can submit the “Human Research Determination Form (HRP-503)” in ETHOS.  Follow the directions for submitting a new study and upload the Determination Form under Question 9 on the first page of web-based application in ETHOS known as the SmartForm.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="007C04DF" w14:paraId="526C6845" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:hyperlink w:anchor="1fob9te">
                <w:r w:rsidR="00124C66">
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>Return to Table of Contents</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="23E8F3E3" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:pStyle w:val="Heading2"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_Toc518040981" w:id="41"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>How do I submit new Human Research to the IRB?</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="41"/>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="3AE1169E" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Studies that meet the federal definition of human research require IRB approval before recruitment or other study-related activities can begin.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="682D8C5B" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Create a New Study in ETHOS by clicking on the web-based application in ETHOS known as the SmartForm, attach all requested supplemental documents and submit the form by clicking the “Submit” activity.  Before submitting the research for initial review, you must:</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="366E5A8C" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="7"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Obtain the financial interest status (“yes” or “no”) of each research staff; and</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="42947E62" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="7"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">Obtain the agreement of all study personnel to their respective roles in the research. </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="55C1410E" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="7"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Obtain the FDA Form 1572 (for FDA-regulated studies). Although you are not required to submit this, the IRB may request it during its review.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="71E98C8D" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">For complete submission instructions, see the </w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:hyperlink r:id="rId33">
                <w:r>
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>ETHOS job aids</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve"> including the </w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:hyperlink r:id="rId34">
                <w:r>
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>New Submission Checklist</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="007C04DF" w14:paraId="27C1EE97" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:hyperlink w:anchor="1fob9te">
                <w:r w:rsidR="00124C66">
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>Return to Table of Contents</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="55EAE9F3" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:pStyle w:val="Heading2"/>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_Toc518040982" w:id="42"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Who is considered Study Personnel for purposes of IRB submission?</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="42"/>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="301DF9FA" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>The following information provides guidance for adding research personnel to ETHOS. This guidance applies to both new applications and updates to existing, approved applications. Note that changes in personnel must be submitted to the IRB as they occur.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="090BB87A" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>For purposes of applying to the IRB, research personnel are individuals who:</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="21B0CCD4" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="78"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Interact with human subjects (e.g., informed consent process, manipulating subject’s environment for research purposes, conduct invasive or non-invasive research procedures), or</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="16AEB6D0" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="78"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Are involved with collecting, reporting, or analyzing identifiable subject data, or</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="47A7FC37" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="78"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">Function outside of regular work practice to conduct research (e.g., student administering research testing),* or </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="12839BBB" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="78"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">Are faculty advisors providing direct oversight of research involving human subjects, or human subjects’ private information, or </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="5DFA0EED" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="78"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Are listed on FDA Form 1572 (Statement of Investigator) even if (a) – (d) do not otherwise apply.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="5D1B8A90" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
                <w:ind w:left="720" w:hanging="360"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">* If an individual is functioning within his or her regular work practice (e.g., performing his/her job providing clinical care as a physician but referring potential participants to a research study; a phlebotomist following standard practice collecting blood for research tests; or an x-ray technician following standard practice performing an x-ray for research , etc.) </w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:r>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:b/>
                </w:rPr>
                <w:t>and involvement in the research is limited to only those work responsibilities without further contribution to the research</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">, then such individuals do not need to be listed in ETHOS. </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="049FA8CF" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Funding agencies may have their own definition of research personnel (i.e., “key personnel”); however, researchers are required to comply with IRB guidance when listing personnel in ETHOS.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="7C1BAF4A" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Individuals with the following roles must be included in the ETHOS study record:</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="4D209C86" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="47"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">Principal Investigator – the person responsible for the conduct of the study including leading the study team, when applicable; </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="77219738" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="47"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">Advisor of Student-Investigator – the person responsible for direct oversight of the study including leading the student-investigator; </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="5EB337AD" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="47"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
