                <w:t>Sub-Investigator(s) (or co-investigators) – any individual member of the study team who will perform study procedures and make research protocol decisions;</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="1C6BDD43" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="47"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">Study Coordinator; </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="71141F04" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="47"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">Any other member of the study team to whom the investigator delegates responsibility for making research protocol decisions, including staff obtaining consent for research participation; </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="2BF6C7D4" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="47"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Staff collecting, reporting or analyzing identifiable subject data; and</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="355CCEBB" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="47"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">Staff who will have subject contact and/or access to identifiable subject data. </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="4473B70C" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Document study team members that are appointed as temporary/casual workers or volunteers at the University of Minnesota who do not have access to ETHOS by completing the ETHOS “External Team Member Information Form (</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:hyperlink r:id="rId35">
                <w:r>
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="1155CC"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>HRP-216</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">)”. In this form, also document external study personnel </w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:hyperlink r:id="rId36">
                <w:r>
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>engaged</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve"> in human research activities </w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:r>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:b/>
                </w:rPr>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">ONLY IF </w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">the University of Minnesota has agreed to serve as the IRB of record for that external institution or external collaborator under a </w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:hyperlink r:id="rId37">
                <w:r>
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>Reliance Agreement</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve"> or </w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:hyperlink r:id="rId38">
                <w:r>
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>Individual Investigator Agreement</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve"> (“IIA”). Upload this form under "External Staff" in the ETHOS smart form. </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="007C04DF" w14:paraId="26421C68" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:hyperlink w:anchor="1fob9te">
                <w:r w:rsidR="00124C66">
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>Return to Table of Contents</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="51487B7A" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:rFonts w:ascii="Arial" w:hAnsi="Arial" w:eastAsia="Arial" w:cs="Arial"/>
                    <w:b/>
                    <w:i/>
                    <w:sz w:val="28"/>
                    <w:szCs w:val="28"/>
                </w:rPr>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:br w:type="page"/>
            </w:r>
            <w:r>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:rFonts w:ascii="Arial" w:hAnsi="Arial" w:eastAsia="Arial" w:cs="Arial"/>
                    <w:b/>
                    <w:i/>
                    <w:sz w:val="28"/>
                    <w:szCs w:val="28"/>
                </w:rPr>
                <w:t>What are the expectations for UMP employees listed as study personnel?</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="64B5CBEA" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:color w:val="202020"/>
                </w:rPr>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:color w:val="202020"/>
                </w:rPr>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">UMP employees, other than physicians, without University appointments can be asked by University PIs to assist on human research studies. To do so, UMP staff must be listed on the IRB application in ETHOS. UMP employees without active UMN internet IDs must request a guest account to be listed on an ETHOS IRB submission. A link to request these accounts can be found on the </w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:hyperlink r:id="rId39">
                <w:r>
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="1155CC"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>ETHOS log-in webpage</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
            <w:r>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:color w:val="202020"/>
                </w:rPr>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">. </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="2D5CAC9F" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:color w:val="202020"/>
                </w:rPr>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:color w:val="202020"/>
                </w:rPr>
                <w:t>Research staff listed on UMN human research studies must adhere to all laws, regulations, standards and requirements that govern research studies and clinical trials.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="575716B8" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:pStyle w:val="Heading2"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_Toc518040983" w:id="43"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>What is the distinction between social behavioral research and biomedical research?</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="43"/>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="430F6B35" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:i/>
                    <w:color w:val="333333"/>
                    <w:u w:val="single"/>
                </w:rPr>
                <w:t>Biomedical research</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="4190AC57" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Biomedical research refers to the study of specific diseases and conditions (mental or physical), including detection, cause, prophylaxis, treatment and rehabilitation of persons; the design of methods, drugs and devices used to diagnose, support and maintain the individual during and after treatment for specific diseases or conditions; and/or the scientific investigation required to understand the underlying life processes which affect disease and human well-being, including such areas as cellular and molecular bases of diseases, genetics, immunology. This research is typically quantitative and not qualitative.  Biomedical research is often patient-oriented and the research involves:</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="66306882" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="56"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Studies of mechanisms of human disease</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="6A263A6F" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="56"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Studies of therapies or interventions for disease</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="579CB427" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="56"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Clinical trials (see “SOP-Definitions (HRP-001)”)</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="31B8115D" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="56"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Studies to develop new technology related to disease</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="7D7EE46A" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:b/>
                    <w:i/>
                    <w:u w:val="single"/>
                </w:rPr>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:i/>
                    <w:u w:val="single"/>
                </w:rPr>
                <w:t>Social-Behavioral Research</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="080DA93A" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Social-behavioral research refers broadly to research that deals with human attitudes, beliefs, and behavior and is often characterized by data collection methods such as questionnaires, interviews, focus groups, direct or participant observation, and non-invasive physical measurements. It may include physical outcomes as they relate to psychosocial processes which may increase the risk of poor health outcomes, but excludes the study of patient populations identified by their diseases/disorders or studies of the mechanisms of specific human diseases.  The research may be qualitative or quantitative. Social-behavioral research also includes epidemiological or outcomes research and health services research:</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="0F21CD25" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="83"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:b/>
                </w:rPr>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">Educational studies: These types of studies examine the </w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>effectiveness of educational programs, practices, and policies, including the application of technology to instruction and assessment.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="1EC7CB53" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="83"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:b/>
                </w:rPr>
                <w:t>Epidemiological and behavioral studies:</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:r>
                <w:t> These types of studies examine the distribution of disease, the factors that affect health, and how people make health-related decisions.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="71D0028B" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="83"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:b/>
                </w:rPr>
                <w:t>Outcomes and health services research:</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:r>
                <w:t> These studies seek to identify the most effective and most efficient interventions, treatments, and services.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="007C04DF" w14:paraId="53FE9511" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
                <w:ind w:right="75"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:hyperlink w:anchor="1fob9te">
                <w:r w:rsidR="00124C66">
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>Return to Table of Contents</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="68A98FB4" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:pStyle w:val="Heading2"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_Toc518040984" w:id="44"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>When is social behavioral research subject to biomedical research requirements (i.e. regulatory, training, etc.)?</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="44"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve"> </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="4BFAE71F" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
                <w:ind w:right="75"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Social-behavioral studies that involve the use of drugs or devices, radiation and radiolabeled tracers, and other invasive procedures require review by a biomedical IRB panel and subject to any additional regulatory requirements as appropriate. In addition, the principal investigator and study personnel must complete the biomedical training requirements (see “Human Research Education and Training (HRP-066)”).</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="73817E54" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
                <w:ind w:right="75"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Prospective collection of biological specimens (e.g., blood, saliva) and/or collection of data via non-invasive measures (e.g. magnetic resonance imaging without the use of radiotracers, tests of sensory acuity, electrocardiography) that are usually considered clinical in nature may be reviewed by a social-behavioral IRB panel if:</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="49D85633" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="12"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
                <w:ind w:right="150"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>The purpose of the research is primarily social-behavioral in nature; and</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="0B6FBBC5" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="12"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
                <w:ind w:right="150"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>The physiological interventions are sufficiently benign as to involve no more than minimal risk to subjects.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="007C04DF" w14:paraId="588334DB" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
                <w:ind w:right="150"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:hyperlink w:anchor="1fob9te">
                <w:r w:rsidR="00124C66">
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>Return to Table of Contents</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="3C8F898E" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:pStyle w:val="Heading2"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_Toc518040985" w:id="45"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>How do I write an Investigator Protocol?</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="45"/>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="699CD7D0" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>For all new studies submitted for IRB review in ETHOS, investigators will complete a brief smart-form, provide a research protocol and attach any relevant study materials (e.g. recruitment material, consent forms, instruments, brochures). Only IRB approved templates, or departmental templates pre-approved by the HRPP, may be used.  Available template protocols include:</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="41102E7D" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="34"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>“MEDICAL TEMPLATE PROTOCOL (HRP-590)”</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="24D448C7" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="34"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>“SOCIAL TEMPLATE PROTOCOL (HRP-580)”</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="7EF8CC30" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="34"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>“DATA &amp; SPECIMEN TEMPLATE PROTOCOL (HRP-595)”</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="29BE3BBC" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Use the applicable template protocol as a starting point for drafting a new Investigator Protocol, and reference the instructions in italic text for the information the IRB looks for when reviewing research. Here are some key points to remember when developing an Investigator Protocol:</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="02065D2A" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="8"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>There are two versions of each protocol template, one with italicized instructions and one without. Use the version with italicized instructions as a reference when completing the version without instructions;</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="4930BAC5" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="8"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>If you received a sponsor’s protocol, use “SITE SUPPLEMENT TO SPONSOR PROTOCOL (HRP-508) instead to describe your local activities;</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="6D79FF58" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="8"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">Only upload a WORD version of the protocol in ETHOS. PDFs are generally not accepted. </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="7C45B366" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="1"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="8"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">If a sponsor provides a PDF version of the protocol, request a WORD version of the protocol from the sponsor. </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="19004791" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="1"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="8"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>The IRB recognizes that not all sponsors will provide a WORD version of a protocol due to document ownership and version control concerns. If this happens, the investigator should submit the PDF version of the protocol and ‘Add a Comment’ to the submission indicating that the sponsor will not provide a WORD version for IRB review.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="3AC654BA" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="1"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="8"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">In the event of changes to a sponsor protocol (in PDF format), when submitting to the IRB the revised protocol PDF, the revision should note in detail the summary of changes. This summary should be appended to the protocol PDF file using the ‘Import Page/File’ or ‘Add Page/File’ feature of Adobe. The summary should be inserted at the beginning of the protocol PDF. </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="65AD2F3F" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="8"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Note that, depending on the nature of your research, certain sections of the template may not be applicable to your Investigator Protocol. Indicate ”N/A” as appropriate, but do not delete those sections;</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="3FFA6F42" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="8"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>You may not involve any individuals who are members of the following populations as participants in your research unless you indicate this in your inclusion criteria as the inclusion of participants from these populations has regulatory implications:</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="058B1BFC" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="1"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="8"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Children;</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="44BD4054" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="1"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="8"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Pregnant women;</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="2B59AFAF" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="1"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="8"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Prisoners;</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="2AB585E5" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="1"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="8"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Adults lacking capacity to consent and/or adults with diminished capacity to consent;</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="10DE7A4F" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="1"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="8"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Non-English speakers;</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="4206F38E" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="1"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="8"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Those unable to read (illiterate);</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="1FBA53AC" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="1"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="8"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Employees of the researcher; and/or</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="4A28B318" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="1"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="8"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Students of the researcher.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="007C04DF" w14:paraId="166B6FBF" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:hyperlink w:anchor="1fob9te">
                <w:r w:rsidR="00124C66">
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>Return to Table of Contents</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="32AAA590" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:pStyle w:val="Heading2"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_Toc518040986" w:id="46"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>How do I create a consent document?</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="46"/>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="579E6179" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">Use the consent template most appropriate for your study.  All consent templates are available in the </w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:hyperlink r:id="rId40">
                <w:r>
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>HRPP Toolkit Library</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="720E48D4" w14:textId="3760EA74">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>If the study is approved to use an external IRB, use the non-local standard consent language templates (</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:hyperlink r:id="rId41">
                <w:r>
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="1155CC"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t xml:space="preserve">HRP-542a - Quorum IRB Review standard language, HRP-542b - Advarra standard language, </w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
            <w:hyperlink r:id="rId42">
                <w:r>
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="1155CC"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>HRP-542c - IRB standard language</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>) for studies that do not intend to use the IRB’s consent templates to ensure required information or language is captured in the consent document.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="290CE01B" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">When a consent template is developed by a sponsor or the study will rely on an external IRB other than Quorum IRB Review or Advarra, ensure that the consent template includes the University’s required language noted in “Template: IRB Standard Language (HRP-542c).” </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="6DFE45A5" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Note that all long form consent documents and all summaries for short form consent documents must contain all of the required and all additional appropriate elements of consent disclosure. Review the “Long Form of Consent Documentation” section in the IRB’s “WORKSHEET: Criteria for Approval (HRP-314)” to ensure that these elements are addressed. The templates have been revised to address new elements of consent in the revised Common Rule, including the requirement to begin the consent process with a presentation of key information. These templates can be used before the revised Common Rule is in effect as the documents to not conflict with the pre-2018 Common Rule.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="4EC2C2FA" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>For specific requirements for both the informed consent process and the documentation of participants’ consent to participate in research, see also “SOP: Informed Consent Process for Research (HRP-090)” and “SOP: Written Documentation of Consent (HRP-091).”</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="007C04DF" w14:paraId="20BECA5D" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:hyperlink w:anchor="1fob9te">
                <w:r w:rsidR="00124C66">
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>Return to Table of Contents</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="52660795" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:pStyle w:val="Heading2"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_Toc518040987" w:id="47"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>How do I create an assent document?</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="47"/>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="2F3DC901" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Use the “TEMPLATE ASSENT DOCUMENT (HRP-583)” to create an assent document or “TEMPLATE ASSENT SCRIPT (HRP-584)” to create an assent script.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="7054F816" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>There is no specific age for when assent is required. You are expected to create an assent form that is age-appropriate and study-specific, taking into account the typical child's experience and level of understanding, and composing a document that treats the child respectfully and conveys the essential information about the study. The IRB will ultimately make a determination as to whether assent is required on a study-by-study basis.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="06BE6433" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>The document should be child friendly in content and appearance. Illustrations might be helpful, and larger type makes a form easier for younger children to read. Studies involving older children or adolescents should include more information and may use more complex language. Parental consent forms also may be revised to include the assent of older children, provided the directive language is revised and the appropriate signature and date lines are added.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="007C04DF" w14:paraId="5116A3E9" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:hyperlink w:anchor="1fob9te">
                <w:r w:rsidR="00124C66">
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>Return to Table of Contents</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="6C9B0200" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:pStyle w:val="Heading3"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_32hioqz" w:colFirst="0" w:colLast="0" w:id="48"/>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_Toc518040988" w:id="49"/>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="48"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Information Sheets</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="49"/>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="11A8AA78" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>In circumstances where the research involves an option for a child whose illness has not responded to other available treatments or for whom standard therapies are not suitable, it is unlikely that a child’s refusal to participate would be honored. In such cases, it is more appropriate to provide children with an information sheet that contains the same information as an assent form would, but without the indication of choice. This respects the child’s right to understand the research and what will happen to him/her, while acknowledging that there are situations in which a parent’s authority must override the wishes of the child.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="0EA089CD" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Additional information about the inclusion of children in research is included in “CHECKLIST: Children (HRP-416)”.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="007C04DF" w14:paraId="3FD32689" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:hyperlink w:anchor="1fob9te">
                <w:r w:rsidR="00124C66">
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>Return to Table of Contents</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="227A1DED" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:pStyle w:val="Heading2"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_Toc518040989" w:id="50"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>How do I create a parental permission document?</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="50"/>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="41DAE3DD" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>For research involving children, generally one or both parents give permission on behalf of a child to participate in research. Use the “TEMPLATE PARENTAL PERMISSION DOCUMENT (HRP-585)” to create a permission document. Depending on how your research is approved, one or both parent signatures may be required. Consult “CHECKLIST: Children (HRP-416)” to evaluate the criteria the IRB uses to determine the level of risk and required signatures for your research to decide how many signature blocks you should include on your parent permission document.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="007C04DF" w14:paraId="05647C2A" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:hyperlink w:anchor="1fob9te">
                <w:r w:rsidR="00124C66">
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>Return to Table of Contents</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="7AFC19CA" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:pStyle w:val="Heading2"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_Toc518040990" w:id="51"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>How do I protect the security and confidentiality of research data?</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="51"/>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="347665FA" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">You are expected to plan for the appropriate protection of data that could be identified with individuals or groups through mechanisms appropriate to the medium in which the data are collected, analyzed, stored, or transmitted.  You must document this plan on in your protocol and explain the provisions for confidentiality to prospective participants during the consent process and within consent documents.  </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="3D32EA95" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">If appropriate, a waiver or alteration of the consent process or waiver of written documentation of consent may be requested in order to provide an additional measure of confidentiality. </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="655E29E6" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Additional information and required language can be found in the “Social-Behavioral Consent Template (HRP-582),” “Biomedical Consent Template (HRP-592),” “WORKSHEET: Waiver or Alteration of Consent Process (HRP-410),” and “WORKSHEET: Waiver of Written Documentation of Consent (HRP-411)” and in the protocol templates.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="687A393D" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">In order to manage data security risks, units and University community members must ensure that their electronic devices and other resources which store, transmit, or process University information meet the information security processes and standards contained in the </w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:hyperlink r:id="rId43">
                <w:r>
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="1155CC"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>Information Security Policy</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="33F2CD73" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">For most types of Human Subject research University policy requires that a professional IT organization manage the systems or that an exception to University policy is filed. If you </w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:hyperlink r:id="rId44">
                <w:r>
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="1155CC"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>manage your own research data</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve"> storage or IT systems, a </w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:hyperlink r:id="rId45">
                <w:r>
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="1155CC"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>gap analysis</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve"> to the University information security standards is required. This may also be useful for a Data Management Plan. The following are additional resources that may be helpful:</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="04C08B06" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Policies</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>

                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve"> when you have questions involving private data, the security of technology provided by a vendor. UIS staff also consult with University members on information security in architecture, software acquisition, governance and compliance requirements, business processes, and network design. Email: </w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:hyperlink r:id="rId55">

        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="63BD0764" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:pStyle w:val="Heading2"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_Toc518040991" w:id="52"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>What is a COC (Certificate of Confidentiality)?</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="52"/>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="65D167FC" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>A Certificate of Confidentiality (COC) protects the privacy of research participants by prohibiting forced disclosure of their individually identifiable, sensitive research information to anyone not associated with the research, except when the participant consents to such disclosures or in other limited specific situations.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="2D8F1487" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">Effective October 1, 2017, all ongoing or new research as of December 13, 2016 that is: </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="65133AAF" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="67"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>funded wholly or in part by the NIH and</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="2DBF3BE5" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="67"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>collects or uses identifiable, sensitive information</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="1C697E62" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>is automatically issued a Certificate of Confidentiality as a term and condition of the NIH grant award. Certificates will no longer be issued in a separate document. The Notice of Award and the NIH Grants Policy Statement will serve as documentation of the Certificate protection.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="1622464D" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">NOTE: The intent of a COC is to prevent forced disclosure of identifiable participant information (for example, in response to a subpoena or other legal demand). The intent of a COC is not to withhold this information from individuals at the research institution who need access in order to perform their job duties (for example, information needed for scheduling a participant for a study visit). </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="007C04DF" w14:paraId="3BEFC380" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:hyperlink w:anchor="1fob9te">
                <w:r w:rsidR="00124C66">
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>Return to Table of Contents</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="782BE2EF" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:pStyle w:val="Heading2"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_Toc518040992" w:id="53"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>What are my responsibilities for a Certificate of Confidentiality?</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="53"/>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="46ADD812" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">Researchers are required to determine whether their research records generated with NIH funding are covered by a COC. </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="1646FE16" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:pStyle w:val="Heading3"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_3fwokq0" w:colFirst="0" w:colLast="0" w:id="54"/>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_Toc518040993" w:id="55"/>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="54"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Determine applicability of the NIH COC Policy:</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="55"/>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="3C8E59C6" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="31"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Was the research begun or ongoing on or after December 13, 2016?</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="3C16DB38" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
                <w:ind w:left="720"/>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:i/>
                </w:rPr>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:i/>
                </w:rPr>
                <w:t>If the answer is “no”, the policy does not apply. If the answer is “yes”, answer the following questions.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="53E4C876" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="31"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Is the research conducted or funded wholly or in part by NIH?</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="0AEB3DE6" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="31"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Is the activity biomedical, behavioral, clinical, or other research?</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="7DB24AA9" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
                <w:ind w:left="720"/>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:i/>
                </w:rPr>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:i/>
                </w:rPr>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">If the answer to </w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:r>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:i/>
                    <w:u w:val="single"/>
                </w:rPr>
                <w:t>either</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:r>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:i/>
                </w:rPr>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve"> question 2 or 3 is “no”, then the activity is not issued a CoC and the policy does not apply. If the answer to both is “yes”, answer the following questions:</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="3BE738BF" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="31"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Does the research involve human subjects as defined by 45 CFR Part 46?</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="3078BAE6" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="31"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Are you collecting or using biospecimens that are identifiable to an individual as part of the research?</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="22A6D649" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
                <w:ind w:left="720"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>The term “identifiable, sensitive information” means information about an individual that is gathered or used during the course of biomedical, behavioral, clinical or other research where the following may occur:</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="757761FE" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="1"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="31"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>An individual is identified; or</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="7FF7454E" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="1"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="31"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>For which there is at least a very a small risk that some combination of the information, a request for the information, and other available data sources could be used to deduce the identity of an individual.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="4C2AC13D" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="31"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>If collecting or using biospecimens as part of the research, is there a small risk that some combination of the biospecimens, a request for the biospecimens, and other available data sources could be used to deduce the identity of an individual?</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="1F441D66" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="31"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Does the research involve the generation of individual level human genomic data?</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="13289C89" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
                <w:ind w:left="720"/>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:i/>
                </w:rPr>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:i/>
                </w:rPr>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">If the answer </w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:r>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:i/>
                    <w:u w:val="single"/>
                </w:rPr>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">to any of the questions numbered 4-7 </w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:r>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:i/>
                </w:rPr>
                <w:t>is “yes”, then a CoC is automatically issued and the policy applies.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="1809FC61" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="31"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>If the policy applies, submit a Modification or a Modification/Continuing Review in ETHOS and review responsibilities to communicate to subjects.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="5223C916" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:pStyle w:val="Heading3"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_1v1yuxt" w:colFirst="0" w:colLast="0" w:id="56"/>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_Toc518040994" w:id="57"/>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="56"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Communicate COC coverage to study subjects:</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="57"/>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="41E64582" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="33"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
                <w:ind w:left="720"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Is the research still open to enrollment?</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="3A055103" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
                <w:ind w:left="720"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>When a COC covers the research records, and informed consent will be obtained from participants, the participants must be told about the protections afforded by the COC and any exceptions to those protections. Consent form templates have been revised to include language</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:r>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:vertAlign w:val="superscript"/>
                </w:rPr>
                <w:t>2</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve"> that addresses the COC policy. This language must be present in consent forms of studies to which the policy applies so that all subjects signing a consent form receive the information. Subjects who have already signed a consent form do not need to sign another (re-consent) solely for this purpose, but researchers may choose to re-consent subjects if this approach works best for them. Submit revised consent forms to the IRB for review. See below for more details.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="7901B02F" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
                <w:ind w:left="720"/>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:b/>
                    <w:i/>
                </w:rPr>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:b/>
                    <w:i/>
                </w:rPr>
                <w:t>See “</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:hyperlink r:id="rId56">
                <w:r>
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:b/>
                        <w:i/>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>Consent Form Template for Medical Research (HRP-592)</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
            <w:r>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:b/>
                    <w:i/>
                </w:rPr>
                <w:t>” or “</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:hyperlink r:id="rId57">
                <w:r>
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:b/>
                        <w:i/>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>Consent Form Template for Social/Behavioral Research (HRP-582)</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
            <w:r>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:b/>
                    <w:i/>
                </w:rPr>
                <w:t>” for COC template language.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="50D101F2" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="33"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
                <w:ind w:left="720"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>What about subjects who have already signed a consent form for the study?</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="7D4478F4" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
                <w:ind w:left="720"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">When a COC covers the research records for studies and informed consent has already been obtained from participants, researchers can prepare an information sheet that speaks to the protections afforded by the COC and the exceptions to those protections. All participants in the study should be sent or given a copy of the information sheet and a note made in the study record that the information sheet has been provided. A template information sheet for COCs is in the toolkit library under “Templates”. Submit revised consent forms to the IRB for review. </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="46E112E4" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
                <w:ind w:left="720"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">Researchers must be aware that information protected by a COC and all copies are subject to the protections of the COC in perpetuity. If a secondary researcher receives information protected by a COC, the secondary researcher is required to uphold the protections.  Researchers who provide a secondary researcher with data protected by a COC should inform the secondary researcher of the continuing obligation to protect the data. </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="439E7E2F" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
                <w:ind w:left="720"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:highlight w:val="white"/>
                </w:rPr>
                <w:t>Researchers should also be aware that if the study continues to enroll additional participants after your NIH funding ends, those participants will not be protected by the Certificate unless you apply for a Certificate following the process for non-federally funded research.</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:r>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:rFonts w:ascii="Arial" w:hAnsi="Arial" w:eastAsia="Arial" w:cs="Arial"/>
                    <w:highlight w:val="white"/>
                </w:rPr>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve"> </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="325BA43F" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
                <w:ind w:left="720"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Researchers should also be aware that certificates will be issued for applicable research regardless of the country where the investigator or the protected information resides though a COC may not be effective for data held in foreign countries.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="00B8D032" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
                <w:ind w:left="720"/>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:b/>
                    <w:i/>
                </w:rPr>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:b/>
                    <w:i/>
                </w:rPr>
                <w:t>Should you ever receive a subpoena, or any other legal process request seeking disclosure of research records do not release any records or information before you have contacted the:</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="4D17B055" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="1"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="33"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:b/>
                </w:rPr>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:b/>
                </w:rPr>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">University of Minnesota Office of the Vice President for Research (OVPR) </w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:hyperlink r:id="rId58">
                <w:r>
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:b/>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>https://research.umn.edu/</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
            <w:r>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:b/>
                </w:rPr>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve"> </w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:r>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:b/>
                    <w:i/>
                </w:rPr>
                <w:t>and the</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:r>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:b/>
                </w:rPr>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve"> Office of the General Counsel (OGC) </w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:hyperlink r:id="rId59">
                <w:r>
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:b/>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>https://ogc.umn.edu/</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
            <w:r>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:b/>
                </w:rPr>
                <w:t>.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="20D48021" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="1"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="33"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
                <w:rPr>

            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:b/>
                </w:rPr>
                <w:t>The OGC will assist researchers with responding to the legal request for records, and with enforcing the privacy protections.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="1344295D" w14:textId="77777777">

            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="38F3912E" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:pStyle w:val="Heading3"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_4f1mdlm" w:colFirst="0" w:colLast="0" w:id="58"/>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_Toc518040995" w:id="59"/>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="58"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Certificates of Confidentiality for 1) Other HHS agencies (Non-NIH), 2) Non-HHS Federal Funders, or 3) Non-Federal Funders</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="59"/>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="7315549E" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">A number of other HHS agencies also issue CoCs. For information and instructions go to:  </w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:hyperlink r:id="rId61">
                <w:r>

                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="145C3979" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">Information and templates for requesting a CoC when the funding source is not an HHS agency, or when the funding source is not federal can also be found at the link above.  </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="3115850A" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="160" w:after="160" w:line="276" w:lineRule="auto"/>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:highlight w:val="white"/>
                </w:rPr>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:highlight w:val="white"/>
                </w:rPr>
                <w:t>Non-Federally funded researchers who are applying for a CoC should draft the COC assurance template according to language provided at the above web-link and contact the IRB office for assistance when seeking the Institutional Official’s signature.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="007C04DF" w14:paraId="219D9F4F" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:hyperlink w:anchor="1fob9te">
                <w:r w:rsidR="00124C66">
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>Return to Table of Contents</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="36F568E6" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:pStyle w:val="Heading2"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_Toc518040996" w:id="60"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>What are my responsibilities for data security?</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="60"/>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="7FC6192A" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">If your protocol proposes use of any non-standard technology for data collection and management, you should provide documentation demonstrating that the technology is appropriately secure.  In addition, you are expected to follow all University data security policies and procedures when conducting research. </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="6DC069C0" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">In the case of research involving sensitive data, the IRB will require you to include a robust security plan in your protocol and verify compliance with the University’s </w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:hyperlink r:id="rId62">
                <w:r>
                    <w:rPr>
