                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>Data Security Policies</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">. Additional policies that apply include the University’s </w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:hyperlink r:id="rId63">
                <w:r>
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="1155CC"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>Data Security Classification</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve"> and </w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:hyperlink r:id="rId64">
                <w:r>
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="1155CC"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>Information Security</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve"> policies.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="007C04DF" w14:paraId="09A5D095" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:hyperlink w:anchor="1fob9te">
                <w:r w:rsidR="00124C66">
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>Return to Table of Contents</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="393F91E9" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:pStyle w:val="Heading2"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_Toc518040997" w:id="61"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>What about HIPAA?</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="61"/>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="56CD70CF" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">The </w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:hyperlink r:id="rId65">
                <w:r>
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>Health Information Privacy and Compliance Office</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve"> is responsible for ensuring that all University research complies with the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA).   Questions regarding HIPAA compliance should be directed to that office.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="007C04DF" w14:paraId="226D94E3" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:hyperlink w:anchor="1fob9te">
                <w:r w:rsidR="00124C66">
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>Return to Table of Contents</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="60F57A37" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:pStyle w:val="Heading2"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_Toc518040998" w:id="62"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Does my research require scientific assessment?</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="62"/>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="445E8132" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>The purpose of scientific assessment is to encourage the development of scientifically sound medical research.  To justify the inclusion of human participants in research, and to assess the balance between any risks that may be imposed upon participants with the utility of the outcomes of the investigation, an assessment is required to evaluate the scientific question and appropriateness of the methods planned to answer the scientific question.  This assessment establishes an initial foundation that allows further assessment; IRB reviewers know as they initiate assessment that the study is powered to yield results.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="788F469C" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>The review must be performed by independent reviewers; therefore, members of the research team cannot participate in this review. Only one method of scientific review (see below) is required prior to review by the IRB.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="2B94BAA5" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Scientific assessment is required for medical research that is not exempt under CFR 45 §46.101 (b) or does not qualify for expedited review under CFR 45 §46.110. Scientific assessment applies to the actual clinical research protocol which describes in detail the involvement of human participants.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="007C04DF" w14:paraId="03C91C0B" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:hyperlink w:anchor="1fob9te">
                <w:r w:rsidR="00124C66">
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>Return to Table of Contents</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="55458C24" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:pStyle w:val="Heading3"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_28h4qwu" w:colFirst="0" w:colLast="0" w:id="63"/>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_Toc518040999" w:id="64"/>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="63"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Acceptable Methods for Scientific Assessment</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="64"/>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="681E191E" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>There are four possible mechanisms for scientific assessment:</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="65B67E25" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="75"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Nationally-based, federal funding organizations (NIH, NSF) when research projects have been subjected to full peer review (e.g., review by a study section or grant committee);</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="25124103" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="1"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="9"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>The actual protocol being submitted to the IRB must have been reviewed in its current form. Peer review of a grant that describes a clinical trial in general terms does not satisfy this criterion.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="4854D553" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="1"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="9"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Industry-sponsored clinical trials designed by the sponsor with or without external consultants </w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:r>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:b/>
                </w:rPr>
                <w:t>do not</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:r>
                <w:t> satisfy this criterion for independent peer-review.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="7988A4B2" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="75"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Nationally based non-federal funding organizations (March of Dimes, American Academy of Pediatrics) employing peer review mechanisms for awarding of funding;</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="0A232ED0" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="1"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="69"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>The actual protocol being submitted to the IRB must have been reviewed in its current form. Peer review of a grant that describes a clinical trial in general terms does not satisfy this criterion.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="02C795A4" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="1"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="69"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Industry-sponsored clinical trials designed by the sponsor with or without external consultants do not satisfy this criterion for independent peer-review.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="3DC47145" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="75"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Locally constituted mechanisms using peer review for awarding of funding, or for permission to use resources, including:</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="343A42DB" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="1"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="29"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Cancer Protocol Review Committee (CPRC)</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="3A238D6C" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="1"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="29"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Clinical and Translational Science Institute (CTSI) pilot funding awards</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="00F5351D" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="75"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>All other applicable medical research not reviewed under one of the methods above:</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="5A035AF2" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="1"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="76"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>HRPP facilitated scientific assessment is requested through the </w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:hyperlink r:id="rId66">
                <w:r>
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>CTR Portal</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>. Download the </w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:hyperlink r:id="rId67">
                <w:r>
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>job aid</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
            <w:r>
                <w:t> detailing how to register your project and request assessment.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="4DC4E5B5" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="1"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="76"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:color w:val="1155CC"/>
                    <w:u w:val="single"/>
                </w:rPr>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve"> </w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:hyperlink r:id="rId68">
                <w:r>
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="1155CC"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>Gillette Children’s Specialty Healthcare Scientific Review</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve"> is accepted for research conducted by Gillette affiliated PIs.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="15AD365C" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="1"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="76"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">Review by a biostatistician is required for all applicable research prior to scientific assessment under this method. </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="310B2696" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Medical applications requiring full committee IRB review will not be assigned to a meeting until documentation of scientific review is provided.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="13D4270E" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>The IRB shares in the responsibility for scientific assessment and will further evaluate whether you have the resources necessary to protect participants as reviewers evaluate the criteria for approval.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="007C04DF" w14:paraId="4CEB0067" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:hyperlink w:anchor="1fob9te">
                <w:r w:rsidR="00124C66">
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>Return to Table of Contents</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="6E7B51B9" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:pStyle w:val="Heading2"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_Toc518041000" w:id="65"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>What happens during a HRPP facilitated scientific assessment?</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="65"/>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="0BFB0C0A" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="280"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>HRPP scientific reviewers are asked to consider the following questions in their assessment of scientific merit:</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="3909896A" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="280"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Is the scientific question reasonable?</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="3DE980AC" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="37"/>
                </w:numPr>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>The question is precisely articulated.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="41FA262B" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="37"/>
                </w:numPr>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">The research has the potential to provide new and useful knowledge. </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="349717BD" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="37"/>
                </w:numPr>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">The rationale for the proposed research is supported by the literature/background in the protocol. </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="23767884" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:ind w:left="720"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve"> </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="12FA250A" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="23"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:contextualSpacing/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">Will the methods described in the protocol answer that question? </w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:r>
                <w:tab/>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00B12638" w14:paraId="216BB63E" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:ind w:left="720"/>
            </w:pPr>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="3C3B388C" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="13"/>
                </w:numPr>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Research tests and procedures are appropriate to answer the scientific question.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="46F52C66" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="13"/>
                </w:numPr>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>The proposed research measures are valid and reliable or there are methods proposed to establish validity and reliability.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="46B52137" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="13"/>
                </w:numPr>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>The proposed subject population is appropriate.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="2DC824DB" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="13"/>
                </w:numPr>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">The sample size calculation appears valid and will answer the research question. </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="723AB248" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="13"/>
                </w:numPr>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>The principal investigator is qualified to conduct the research.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="50D6745C" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve"> </w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:hyperlink w:anchor="1fob9te">
                <w:r>
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>Return to Table of Contents</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="4E3ABF2B" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:pStyle w:val="Heading2"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_Toc518041001" w:id="66"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>What other reviews are required for my research?</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="66"/>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="3EC4B4FB" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>In order to assure that all the criteria for approval have been met and that the necessary institutional or healthcare component approvals are in place, the IRB must rely on other components of the system-wide HRPP to review and approve their respective aspects of human research studies.  Some ancillary approvals are required prior to IRB review; others are required prior to the IRB granting final approval.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="1B5FCB4A" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>HRPP staff, in consultation with IRB members, may also assess the need for involvement of other review committees or components of the HRPP on a case-by-case basis.  You are responsible for meeting the requirements of all applicable reviewing components.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="4506A203" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Information about the ancillary review process and the impact of various component reviews is included in the “WORKSHEET: Ancillary Review Requirements (HRP 309).”</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="007C04DF" w14:paraId="2A82158C" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:hyperlink w:anchor="1fob9te">
                <w:r w:rsidR="00124C66">
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>Return to Table of Contents</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="5B816823" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:pStyle w:val="Heading2"/>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:b w:val="false"/>
                </w:rPr>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_Toc518041002" w:id="67"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>What is the basis of the requirement for IRBs to review federal grants?</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="67"/>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="0E84DD1C" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">Federal regulations at </w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:hyperlink w:anchor="46.103" r:id="rId69">
                <w:r>
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>45 CFR 46.103(f)</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve"> require that each grant application or proposal for most federally supported human subjects research be reviewed and approved by an IRB. As part of this review, IRBs are required to ensure that the activities described in the grant are consistent with the proposed or IRB-approved protocol. The University IRB is required to review all grants where the University of Minnesota is a primary awardee.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="007C04DF" w14:paraId="1A233F36" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:hyperlink w:anchor="1fob9te">
                <w:r w:rsidR="00124C66">
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>Return to Table of Contents</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="553CAB65" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:pStyle w:val="Heading2"/>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:b w:val="false"/>
                </w:rPr>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_Toc518041003" w:id="68"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>What if the grant does not match the IRB application?</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="68"/>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="1388250D" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Any discrepancies between the IRB protocol and grant must be resolved or accounted for before the project can be approved. The IRB may request a research team revise an IRB application to reconcile discrepancies (e.g., to add new procedures described in the grant that will be conducted), submit a new initial review application (e.g., when the grant appears to describe a new study), or provide clarification regarding the reason for the differences (e.g., when only part of the grant appears to support the IRB-approved application). Anytime there is a modification to a project that is grant funded, the IRB will review the grant to ensure that the modification is part of the approved grant. If not, then the PI will be asked by the IRB to provide documentation from the funder that the additional research activity is approved by the funder.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="007C04DF" w14:paraId="690211A7" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:hyperlink w:anchor="1fob9te">
                <w:r w:rsidR="00124C66">
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>Return to Table of Contents</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="0F6C1AC6" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:pStyle w:val="Heading2"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_Toc518041004" w:id="69"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Do training grants or program grants that have cores require IRB review?</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="69"/>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="414BCF02" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>If a grant does not directly support human subject research, IRB review and approval is not needed unless required by the funding agency. Please contact the IRB Office for instructions on how to submit these for review if documentation of review is required.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="14515898" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>NOTE: Any human subject research studies that receive funds from the grant to support the proposed research will require IRB review and approval.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="007C04DF" w14:paraId="0FC08308" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:hyperlink w:anchor="1fob9te">
                <w:r w:rsidR="00124C66">
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>Return to Table of Contents</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="676F8C24" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:pStyle w:val="Heading2"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_Toc518041005" w:id="70"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>What if I’m receiving a grant award but my plans for Human Research are not fully defined?</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="70"/>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="3D6030CC" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">Some applications for grants, cooperative agreements, or contracts are submitted to funding agencies with the knowledge that subjects may be involved within the period of support, but definite plans would not normally be set forth in the application or proposal.  Often in these cases, grant money is sought to develop or refine plans for inclusion of human subjects at a future time. </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="2E3CD548" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">These proposals may include projects where activities are yet to be identified or research staff need to be hired, or projects where instruments or plans need to be developed. </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="6ECEF675" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>If you find yourself in this situation, the grant need not be reviewed by the IRB before an award may be made. Please contact the IRB Office for instructions on how to submit these for review if documentation of review is required.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="14D1D567" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>NOTE: No human subjects may be involved in any project until the project has been fully reviewed and approved by the IRB.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="007C04DF" w14:paraId="50F47D4D" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:hyperlink w:anchor="1fob9te">
                <w:r w:rsidR="00124C66">
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>Return to Table of Contents</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="4E77C53E" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:pStyle w:val="Heading2"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_Toc518041006" w:id="71"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>What if I applied for federal funding and received a Just-in-Time notification?</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="71"/>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="63D6C64B" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>If you are waiting for a funding decisions from a granting agency, you are encouraged to seek IRB review and approval as soon as it appears funding may be likely.  Just-in- Time (JIT) notifications advise investigators of the requirement to secure IRB approval (among other requirements) prior to any distribution of funding.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="4182253B" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>If you receive a JIT notification and have not already done so, you must submit the study in ETHOS for review. Be sure to indicate in the submission to the IRB that this is a Just-in-Time request and provide documentation from the funding agency about the timing requirement.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="38DB172F" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>The IRB will attempt to prioritize JIT requests to the best of its ability and provide timely and ongoing communication with researchers about the progress of the submission's review and revisions and/or clarifications that may be required before approval can be granted.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="007C04DF" w14:paraId="48153C3E" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:hyperlink w:anchor="1fob9te">
                <w:r w:rsidR="00124C66">
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>Return to Table of Contents</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="71B4EC04" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:pStyle w:val="Heading2"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_Toc518041007" w:id="72"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Is there a fee for IRB review?</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="72"/>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="44CF38F5" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:pStyle w:val="Heading3"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_4k668n3" w:colFirst="0" w:colLast="0" w:id="73"/>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_Toc518041008" w:id="74"/>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="73"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Review Fee for Business- and Industry-Sponsored Projects Reviewed by the University of Minnesota IRB</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="74"/>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="5CC8F13C" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">The IRB assesses a one-time $2,500 fee for initial review of all business-and-industry sponsored clinical trials. All initial study submissions to the IRB must identify the funding sources supporting the proposed research. IRB applications that are dependent on state, federal, non-profit foundations or internal funds will be excluded from the IRB fee as those review costs are covered by indirect costs. Investigator-initiated studies are also excluded from the review fee. </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="23DB69A8" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Under extenuating circumstances, and with appropriate documentation to support such circumstances, you may request a fee waiver from the HRPP Executive Director.  It is normally expected that you or contracts staff incorporate and negotiate the IRB review fee into the research contract.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00B12638" w14:paraId="33712A39" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="176D9E88" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:pStyle w:val="Heading3"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_2zbgiuw" w:colFirst="0" w:colLast="0" w:id="75"/>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_Toc518041009" w:id="76"/>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="75"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Review Fee for Studies from Fairview or Gillette Investigators</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="76"/>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="6367885E" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>The University IRB acts as the IRB for Fairview Health Systems and Gillette Children’s Specialty Healthcare.  Researchers whose sole affiliation is with Fairview Health Systems are assessed a fee for initial review of each study submitted. A negotiated fee is paid annually by Gillette Children’s Specialty Healthcare.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="007C04DF" w14:paraId="15E76A7F" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:hyperlink w:anchor="1fob9te">
                <w:r w:rsidR="00124C66">
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>Return to Table of Contents</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="69ED56A3" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:pStyle w:val="Heading1"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_Toc518041010" w:id="77"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Human Research with Special Study Populations</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="77"/>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="51219683" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:pStyle w:val="Heading2"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_Toc518041011" w:id="78"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>What if I’m including a vulnerable population?</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="78"/>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="1097FDA1" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Vulnerable or potentially vulnerable populations are subject to additional protection under both federal regulations and IRB policy.  Review the “WORKSHEET: Vulnerable Populations (HRP-333)”, as well as the individual Toolkit documents specific to the population you are enrolling as referenced in your protocol template, to ensure you have provided sufficient information.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="007C04DF" w14:paraId="31E9BB64" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:hyperlink w:anchor="1fob9te">
                <w:r w:rsidR="00124C66">
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>Return to Table of Contents</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="6EC6C41E" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:pStyle w:val="Heading2"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_Toc518041012" w:id="79"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>What if I’m doing research involving prisoners?</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="79"/>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="5A5E961A" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Review “CHECKLIST: Prisoners (HRP-415)” to ensure that you have provided sufficient information in the research protocol.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="79B1502A" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Following IRB review and approval of DHHS-supported research involving prisoners, the IRB will provide a certification letter to the Office of Human Research Protections (OHRP) as required in 45CFR46.306.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="225D4A9A" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:pStyle w:val="Heading3"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_sqyw64" w:colFirst="0" w:colLast="0" w:id="80"/>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_Toc518041013" w:id="81"/>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="80"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>When Subjects Become Prisoners During a Research Protocol</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="81"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve"> </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="7003CCC9" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Once the research has commenced, similar considerations apply when a participant becomes a prisoner at any time during the conduct of the study, regardless of study funding.  In this event:</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="5CD428DD" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="62"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Report this to the IRB using the RNI Form in ETHOS; and</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="52308B36" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="62"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">Review “CHECKLIST: Prisoners (HRP-415)” to ensure you have provided sufficient information. </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="007C04DF" w14:paraId="2B598A28" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:hyperlink w:anchor="1fob9te">
                <w:r w:rsidR="00124C66">
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>Return to Table of Contents</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="2515FDD2" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:pStyle w:val="Heading2"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_Toc518041014" w:id="82"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>What if I’m doing research involving children?</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="82"/>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="57B71A3C" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>If your research involves children under the age of 18, review the “CHECKLIST: Children (HRP-416)” and “POLICY: Minnesota Laws Affecting Human Research (HRP-112)”  to ensure that you provide sufficient information in your protocol. Consider whether parental permission and assent should be obtained and incorporate this information in your protocol.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="26764B70" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">See the sections </w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:hyperlink w:anchor="_1f7o1he">
                <w:r>
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:i/>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>How do I create an assent document</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve"> and </w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:hyperlink w:anchor="_3z7bk57">
                <w:r>
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:i/>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>How do I create a parental permission document?</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve"> above to help you determine what information to communicate to your participants and their parents.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="007C04DF" w14:paraId="2338C0C9" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:hyperlink w:anchor="1fob9te">
                <w:r w:rsidR="00124C66">
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>Return to Table of Contents</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="5348A23B" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:pStyle w:val="Heading2"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_Toc518041015" w:id="83"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>What if I’m doing research including adults with absent, diminished or fluctuating capacity to consent to participate in research?</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="83"/>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="248488A7" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">If your research includes cognitively impaired adults, or adults with potentially absent, diminished or fluctuating capacity to consent, review the “CHECKLIST: Cognitively Impaired Adults (HRP-417)”, “POLICY: Capacity to Consent (HRP-110)”,  “POLICY: Research Involving Adults Under Court Jurisdiction (HRP-111), “SOP: Legally Authorized Representatives, Children and Guardians (HRP-013)” and “SOP: Informed Consent Process for Research (HRP-090)” to ensure you have provided sufficient information in your protocol.The IRB recommends and may require the use of participant education materials, including the </w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:hyperlink r:id="rId70">
                <w:r>
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="1155CC"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>brochures and contact cards</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="0B7B32A2" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">Your protocol should specify the validated assessment tool that will be used for assessing capacity to consent to research (See POLICY: Capacity to Consent (HRP-110) for requirements). If the MacCAT-CR or UBACC tool will be used for assessing capacity to consent to research, the assessment record form (such as </w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:hyperlink r:id="rId71">
                <w:r>
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="1155CC"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>MacCAT-CR Assessment Form (HRP-226)</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve"> or </w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:hyperlink r:id="rId72">
                <w:r>
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="1155CC"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>UBACC Interview Form (HRP-227)</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">) does not need to be submitted as part of the IRB submission. However, the IRB may require additional documentation for other tools to determine whether the tool is appropriate in the context of the study and population. </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="10521AAA" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">For studies involving non-English speaking participants, the protocol should describe how the assessment will conducted. The assessment tool does not need to be translated unless the assessor will assess the participant’s capacity to consent by speaking in the participant’s language. For studies where the assessment will conducted in English but will include the involvement of an interpreter, the assessment tool does not need to be translated.  </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="38D5ACDF" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Your protocol should be explicit regarding the use of a legally authorized representative if one may potentially be utilized to consent on behalf of a participating adult.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="7855BAEE" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>As a matter of subjects’ protection, assent should be obtained from incompetent or incapacitated adults for research participation to the extent they are able to provide assent. Even where a legally authorized representative has consented to the research participation, an incompetent or incapacitated adult may not be included over his or her objection (known as dissent).</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="007C04DF" w14:paraId="0BF12716" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:hyperlink w:anchor="1fob9te">
                <w:r w:rsidR="00124C66">
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>Return to Table of Contents</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="3D753CC0" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:pStyle w:val="Heading2"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_Toc518041016" w:id="84"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>What if my research is a UMN Department of Psychiatry clinical drug trial?</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="84"/>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="55A86FB6" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120"/>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:highlight w:val="white"/>
                </w:rPr>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:highlight w:val="white"/>
                </w:rPr>
                <w:t>Department of Psychiatry clinical drug trials require review by Quorum Review IRB. The above referenced required documentation for reliance on Quorum applies to Department of Psychiatry clinical drug trials. Investigators in the Department of Psychiatry conducting clinical drug trials are required to notify The Office of Ombudsman for Mental Health and Developmental Disabilities (OMHDD) within 24 hours of a U of M research participant’s death or serious injury.  </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="39D26A6A" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:highlight w:val="white"/>
                </w:rPr>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">The </w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:hyperlink r:id="rId73">
                <w:r>
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="3375B8"/>
                        <w:highlight w:val="white"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>Ombudsman Reporting Transmittal Form</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
            <w:r>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:highlight w:val="white"/>
                </w:rPr>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve"> is used by HRPP and the University of Minnesota Principal Investigator to report to OMHDD pursuant to Minnesota Statute 245.92 and 245.94. Reports of death or serious injury of locally enrolled study participants in psychiatry clinical drug trials must use the Transmittal Form as the cover page to the applicable report form available on the </w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:hyperlink r:id="rId74">
                <w:r>
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="3375B8"/>
                        <w:highlight w:val="white"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>OMHDD website</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
            <w:r>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:highlight w:val="white"/>
                </w:rPr>
                <w:t>. Additional information on reporting can be found on the OMHDD website:</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:hyperlink r:id="rId75">
                <w:r>
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:highlight w:val="white"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t xml:space="preserve"> </w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
            <w:hyperlink r:id="rId76">
                <w:r>
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="1155CC"/>
                        <w:highlight w:val="white"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>http://mn.gov/omhdd/reporting-death-or-serious-injury/</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
            <w:r>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:highlight w:val="white"/>
                </w:rPr>
                <w:t>.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="5849416B" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:pStyle w:val="Heading2"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_Toc518041017" w:id="85"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>What if my research includes individuals with limited English proficiency?</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="85"/>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="0D5F88B4" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>If your research is targeting individuals with limited English proficiency, you must provide certified, translated versions of the consent form and any key study documents in the anticipated participants’ native language.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="250C2B46" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:color w:val="070707"/>
                </w:rPr>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">If you are not intending to target a population known to have limited English proficiency but intend to include such individuals should they qualify for your study and express interest in participating, you may use the short form consent process with prior approval from the IRB.  Review the “WORKSHEET: Short Form of Consent Documentation and Process (HRP-317)”.  Use “Short Form Consent Template (HRP-507).” You will find available translated short forms on the IRB website </w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:hyperlink w:anchor=".UsIDxrQueqR" r:id="rId77">
                <w:r>
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>HERE</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
            <w:r>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:color w:val="070707"/>
                </w:rPr>
                <w:t>.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="007C04DF" w14:paraId="5EE4D3A6" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:color w:val="070707"/>
                </w:rPr>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:hyperlink w:anchor="1fob9te">
                <w:r w:rsidR="00124C66">
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>Return to Table of Contents</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="0B98827E" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:pStyle w:val="Heading2"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_Toc518041018" w:id="86"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>What translation or certification services are acceptable or required?</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="86"/>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="74D2C08F" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">Exempt research does not require certified translations and the translation can be completed by the researcher if he or she is a native speaker of the language or other appropriate mechanism. However, researchers must provide an attestation that the translation accurately depicts the study information. The attestation should be provided in the IRB submission. </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="54323545" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Certified translations are required for non-exempt research for participant facing materials including recruitment material, consent document, etc. Investigators should consider the following when selecting a service for translation and/or certification of consent documents or key study materials:</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="253273B5" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="72"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:contextualSpacing/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">Qualifications and expertise. For example, biomedical studies should use a service that has translators with medical expertise. </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="1B8D9FDA" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="72"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:contextualSpacing/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Credibility. Review public comments about the service prior to use.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="233A3168" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>The following are vendors (not supported or endorsed by the University of Minnesota) provide translation and certification for many languages and have medical expertise:</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="0A863A00" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="52"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:contextualSpacing/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>BURG Translations (</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:hyperlink r:id="rId78">
                <w:r>
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="1155CC"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>https://burgtranslations.com</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">) </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="5A6BD5F5" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="52"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:contextualSpacing/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>MN Translations (</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:hyperlink r:id="rId79">
                <w:r>
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="1155CC"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>https://www.minnesotatranslations.com</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">) </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="75FC0E8A" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="52"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:contextualSpacing/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Tomedes (</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:hyperlink r:id="rId80">
                <w:r>
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="1155CC"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>https://www.tomedes.com/</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>)</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="61C6AB9B" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="52"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:contextualSpacing/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Click for Translation (</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:hyperlink r:id="rId81">
                <w:r>
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="1155CC"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>https://clickfortranslation.com/</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>): Provides certification of translations completed by someone other than the vendor).</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="1DB253AB" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:after="120"/>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:rFonts w:ascii="Arial" w:hAnsi="Arial" w:eastAsia="Arial" w:cs="Arial"/>
                    <w:color w:val="000000"/>
                    <w:sz w:val="22"/>
                    <w:szCs w:val="22"/>
                </w:rPr>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>If the investigator does not use a commercial vendor, a letter of certification from the translator is required. This letter should include an attestation from the translator, information about the translator’s expertise as it relates to the study topic (i.e. medical expertise for biomedical research), and fluency and experience with the given language. The IRB will review this information to determine whether the translation is sufficient or a commercial service is required. A “</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:hyperlink w:history="true" r:id="rId82">
                <w:r>
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="1155CC"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>Certification Attestation of Translation (HRP-574)</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>” can be used if the translator does not have a standard letter that includes these requirements. This attestation should not reflect or state the investigator’s attestation of the translation and should only be used by translators.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="5D409259" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:pStyle w:val="Heading2"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_Toc518041019" w:id="87"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>What if I’m doing research involving American Indian or Alaskan Native populations?</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="87"/>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="113B4843" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">In order to recognize the autonomous authority of sovereign nations, and acknowledging the need for community awareness and permission for access, the IRB requires Tribal approval for research that is to be conducted within the jurisdiction(s) of federally-recognized American Indian and Alaska Natives (AIAN) Tribal government(s).  You will need to secure approval from the Tribal Council or other agency of Tribal government to whom such authority has been delegated by the Council. </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="2A4FE358" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">The IRB applies this requirement to all research, irrespective of funding source or rank or ethnic/racial identity of the researcher. </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="55D178DD" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">The form of documentation of approval may vary according to tribal requirements. In instances where more than one tribe or band is involved in the research project, separate permission from each entity may be required. Additional IRB or research committee review or approval may also be required by the Tribe. In those cases, final University IRB approval will be contingent upon Tribal approval. </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="007C04DF" w14:paraId="6016A494" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:hyperlink w:anchor="1fob9te">
                <w:r w:rsidR="00124C66">
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>Return to Table of Contents</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="5FB4A9FD" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:pStyle w:val="Heading1"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_Toc518041020" w:id="88"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Human Research Under Special Circumstances</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="88"/>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="30EA4227" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:pStyle w:val="Heading2"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_Toc518041021" w:id="89"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>What if my research is funded by a Federal agency?</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="89"/>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="25F89395" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Additional protocol requirements and PI responsibilities apply to research funded by specific federal agencies.  Review “WORKSHEET: Additional Federal Agency Criteria (HRP-318)” and the applicable Appendix to this Manual to ensure you have provided sufficient information and understand your obligations.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="007C04DF" w14:paraId="4C42848F" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:hyperlink w:anchor="1fob9te">
                <w:r w:rsidR="00124C66">
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>Return to Table of Contents</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="2EE43C17" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:pStyle w:val="Heading2"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_Toc518041022" w:id="90"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>What if I’m doing a case study?</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="90"/>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="04E2058B" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">Individual case reports do not typically meet the definition of </w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:r>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:u w:val="single"/>
                </w:rPr>
                <w:t>Human Research</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve"> as they do not meet the “systematic investigation” or “generalizable knowledge” thresholds. Therefore, case reports generally do not require IRB review. Report about three or fewer clinical experiences or observations identified in the course of clinical care, provided that it does not involve FDA regulated investigational products (e.g., drugs, devices, biologics).  Case reports are generally done by retrospective review of medical records and highlight a unique clinical treatment, case or outcome. Please note: </w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:hyperlink r:id="rId83">
                <w:r>
                    <w:rPr>
