                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>UMN  Health Information Privacy and Compliance  Office (HIPCO)</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve"> review may still be required.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="6DFB4809" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">When a series of case reports is contemplated, consider whether your project meets the definition of </w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:r>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:u w:val="single"/>
                </w:rPr>
                <w:t>Human Research</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">. If you are unsure, submit in ETHOS for a determination. </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="007C04DF" w14:paraId="5C07775B" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:hyperlink w:anchor="1fob9te">
                <w:r w:rsidR="00124C66">
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>Return to Table of Contents</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="257AC217" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:pStyle w:val="Heading2"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_Toc518041023" w:id="91"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>What if I’m teaching a research methods or “courseroom” class?</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="91"/>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="7174B2A3" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Research projects that occur within courses are designed to provide students an opportunity to practice various research methods such as interview, observation and survey techniques, as well as data analysis. Typically such projects are quite limited in scope and are not intended for dissemination or to contribute to generalizable knowledge.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="24F5FF98" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Course-based research projects and data collection activities:</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="0C5B1EBF" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="81"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Should not include potentially vulnerable participants or participants younger than 18 years of age;</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="1EB74587" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="81"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Should not collect or include sensitive, personal or potentially incriminating information or otherwise put participants at risk; and</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="77F31219" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="81"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>The data must be recorded anonymously (i.e., with no name, social security number, or any other code that can be linked to a participant).</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="430A42EA" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>These projects are considered "courseroom exercises" and are not subject to review by the IRB unless the student-investigator anticipates using the results in his or her dissertation, publishing the results or presenting at a professional meeting, or unless the faculty member expects to compile all students’ results with the intention of publishing or presenting. In those situations, the faculty member or student-investigator should submit the “Human Research Determination Form (HRP-503)” in ETHOS and the IRB will make a determination regarding oversight requirements, if any.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="007C04DF" w14:paraId="7BB5F255" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:hyperlink w:anchor="1fob9te">
                <w:r w:rsidR="00124C66">
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>Return to Table of Contents</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="0E1E933B" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:pStyle w:val="Heading2"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_Toc518041024" w:id="92"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>What if I’m conducting community-based participatory research (CBPR)?</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="92"/>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="4602E4B9" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">The IRB supports mechanisms that allow researchers to involve community members in the research process whenever appropriate and encourages researchers to develop and establish positive relationships with the community and community members. </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="780D6013" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">The IRB has experience and knowledge in the conduct and review of CBPR and understands that CBPR protocols may go through multiple changes and iterations before the research is completed and that, in most cases, researchers should plan to inform the community of the results of the research. </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="342BB50F" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>For more information see:</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="007C04DF" w14:paraId="0BCDD98B" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="35"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:color w:val="070707"/>
                </w:rPr>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:hyperlink r:id="rId84">
                <w:r w:rsidR="00124C66">
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t xml:space="preserve">Office of Public Engagement </w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="007C04DF" w14:paraId="731F5BD8" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="35"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:color w:val="070707"/>
                </w:rPr>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:hyperlink r:id="rId85">
                <w:r w:rsidR="00124C66">
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>Urban Research and Outreach/Engagement Center</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="007C04DF" w14:paraId="15137012" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="35"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:color w:val="070707"/>
                </w:rPr>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:hyperlink r:id="rId86">
                <w:r w:rsidR="00124C66">
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>Children Youth and Family Consortium</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="007C04DF" w14:paraId="25BF2D18" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="35"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                    <w:u w:val="single"/>
                </w:rPr>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:hyperlink r:id="rId87">
                <w:r w:rsidR="00124C66">
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>Office of Community Engagement for Health</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="007C04DF" w14:paraId="3231C14B" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:color w:val="070707"/>
                </w:rPr>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:hyperlink w:anchor="1fob9te">
                <w:r w:rsidR="00124C66">
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>Return to Table of Contents</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="39D13057" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:pStyle w:val="Heading2"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_Toc518041025" w:id="93"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>What if my research involves deception?</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="93"/>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="29384822" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Research which requires deception regarding the purpose of the research or any other necessary element of consent is permissible when justified by prospective scientific, educational, or applied value and when effective non-deceptive alternative procedures are not feasible.  Additional consent debriefing requirements are necessary to obtain informed consent for this type of research.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="6F34019D" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">You must provide a prompt opportunity for participants to obtain appropriate information about the nature, results, and conclusions of the research, and then take reasonable steps to correct any misconceptions that participants may have of which the psychologists are aware.  If a participant in a study involving deception chooses to withdraw consent following the debriefing, the data collected in that case may not be included in the analysis of the study. </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="392EC5E4" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Deception is a form of alteration of the consent process and alteration of the consent documentation.  You should review the “CHECKLIST: Waiver or Alteration of Consent Process (HRP-410)” to ensure that you have provided sufficient information.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="007C04DF" w14:paraId="526A9E5C" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:hyperlink w:anchor="1fob9te">
                <w:r w:rsidR="00124C66">
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>Return to Table of Contents</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="5F4A03CA" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:pStyle w:val="Heading2"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_Toc518041026" w:id="94"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>What if I’m doing research involving genetic testing and/or information?</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="94"/>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="35804A74" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">Genetic testing is defined as the analysis of human DNA, RNA, chromosomes, proteins, and certain metabolites in order to detect heritable disease-related genotypes, mutations, phenotypes, or karyotypes. </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="15B51777" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>The Minnesota Genetic Privacy Act</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:r>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:vertAlign w:val="superscript"/>
                </w:rPr>
                <w:footnoteReference w:id="1"/>
            </w:r>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve"> classifies genetic information as private data. The Minnesota Supreme Court has interpreted the definition of genetic information to include blood samples.  Researchers must have written informed consent to collect, use, store or disseminate genetic information, including blood samples, for research.  </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="5F51E31B" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>In addition, certain protection in afforded to participants under the Genetic Information Non-discrimination Act (GINA) where protocols include genetic testing.  See the “TEMPLATE CONSENT DOCUMENT (HRP-590)” for required language.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="007C04DF" w14:paraId="63826975" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:hyperlink w:anchor="1fob9te">
                <w:r w:rsidR="00124C66">
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>Return to Table of Contents</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="1D14A7DD" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:pStyle w:val="Heading2"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_Toc518041027" w:id="95"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>What if I’m doing research with data or specimens?</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="95"/>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="3C789484" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>IRB oversight is required for research use of identifiable private information or identifiable human specimens from research and/or non-research databases or repositories. Investigators may use identifiable private information or identifiable human specimens for research described in the protocol approved by the IRB.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="78E64D83" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">Using identifiable private information or identifiable human specimens for research not described in a protocol approved by the IRB must be reviewed and approved by the IRB. </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="36389852" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">If the proposed new use is an amendment to an already approved protocol, investigators must submit a protocol modification request for IRB review and approval. </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="343853D6" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>If the proposed new use is not an amendment to an already approved protocol, investigators must submit a protocol for prospective IRB review and approval before the research may begin.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="007C04DF" w14:paraId="6FF50E9B" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:hyperlink w:anchor="1fob9te">
                <w:r w:rsidR="00124C66">
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>Return to Table of Contents</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
            <w:r w:rsidR="00124C66">
                <w:t xml:space="preserve"> </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="273E56A8" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:pStyle w:val="Heading2"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_Toc518041028" w:id="96"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>What if I’m doing research with controlled substances?</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="96"/>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="1D8F38BC" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">Investigators conducting research with controlled substances must comply with the University policy, </w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:hyperlink r:id="rId88">
                <w:r>
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:b/>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>Using Controlled Substances for Research</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>, and federal and state regulations relating to controlled substances.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="007C04DF" w14:paraId="1A8045A3" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:hyperlink w:anchor="1fob9te">
                <w:r w:rsidR="00124C66">
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>Return to Table of Contents</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="45FC40AD" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:pStyle w:val="Heading2"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_Toc518041029" w:id="97"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>What if I’m doing research with drugs?</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="97"/>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="794A0B1B" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>The Food and Drug Administration (FDA) requires that a sponsor or investigator obtain an IND from FDA for clinical investigations involving drugs or dietary supplements. If the investigation uses a marketed product, the sponsor or investigator may propose that the investigation is exempt from an IND under 21 CFR 312.2(b) which states:</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="2898F7FB" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
                <w:ind w:left="720"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>(b) Exemptions. (1) The clinical investigation of a drug product that is lawfully marketed in the United States is exempt from the requirements of this part if all the following apply:</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="0F6E24B0" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
                <w:ind w:left="1440"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>(i) The investigation is not intended to be reported to FDA as a well-controlled study in support of a new indication for use nor intended to be used to support any other significant change in the labeling for the drug;</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="0F8238E0" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
                <w:ind w:left="1440"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>(ii) If the drug that is undergoing investigation is lawfully marketed as a prescription drug product, the investigation is not intended to support a significant change in the advertising for the product;</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="11CCA10D" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
                <w:ind w:left="1440"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>(iii) The investigation does not involve a route of administration or dosage level or use in a patient population or other factor that significantly increases the risks (or decreases the acceptability of the risks) associated with the use of the drug product;</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="724B219F" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
                <w:ind w:left="1440"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>(iv) The investigation is conducted in compliance with the requirements for institutional review set forth in part 56 and with the requirements for informed consent set forth in part 50; and</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="4755CFEA" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
                <w:ind w:left="1440"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>(v) The investigation is conducted in compliance with the requirements of 312.7. [regarding marketing and promotion]</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="4216274A" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Criteria (i), (ii), and (v) are under the control of the IND sponsor, and the U of M holds the sponsor responsible for complying with those criteria. Criterion (iv) is satisfied with review by the U of M IRB or an IRB with which the University of Minnesota IRB has a reliance agreement.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="66EE0F35" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>The U of M IND/IDE Regulatory Director will consider whether the conditions for (iii) are met, and will send a written communication via the ancillary review process in ETHOS to the investigator or sponsor-investigator and the IRB addressing that item.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidRPr="00B55462" w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="55CA4F7A" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:after="160"/>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:color w:val="222222"/>
                </w:rPr>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r w:rsidRPr="00B55462">
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:color w:val="222222"/>
                </w:rPr>
                <w:t>A written statement in the protocol should be included, indicating that all the criteria for IND exemption have been met.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidRPr="00B55462" w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="4D57D263" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:color w:val="222222"/>
                </w:rPr>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r w:rsidRPr="00B55462">
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:color w:val="222222"/>
                </w:rPr>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">For cases where the use of the drug is not identical to that described in the FDA approved labeling, provide a rational explaining how the research does not involve a route of administration or dosage level or use in a patient population or other factor that significantly increases the risks (or decreases the acceptability of the risks) associated with the use of the product. </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="3D2EFC5A" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>For clinical investigations using a dietary supplement, the IRB will require that the sponsor of the investigation obtain an IND if the clinical investigation is intended to evaluate the dietary supplement’s ability to diagnose, cure, mitigate, treat, or prevent a disease. The IRB will accept a written statement from the FDA than an IND is not necessary for a given clinical investigation of a dietary supplement.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="4E93E11C" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>University of Minnesota researchers are also required to follow the policy Using Legend and Investigational Drugs for Clinical Research https://policy.umn.edu/research/investigationaldrugs</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="1A2FD5E7" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">If your protocol involves the use of drugs, biologics or tobacco products, review “WORKSHEET: Drugs (HRP-306)”, and “Appendix A-2: Additional Requirements for FDA-Regulated Research” of this Manual to ensure you have provided sufficient information.  </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="382DB385" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Submit a copy of each of the following with your protocol:</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="4C4CBC6C" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="84"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Investigator’s Drug Brochure*</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="36E56389" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="84"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Background Information for Food Supplements*</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="1928529E" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="84"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Documentation from sponsor or FDA verifying the IND (Investigational New Drug) number if one is required for the research.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="3AF634B1" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>* If an IND is not required, provide the reason why in writing.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="007C04DF" w14:paraId="1250341C" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:hyperlink w:anchor="1fob9te">
                <w:r w:rsidR="00124C66">
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>Return to Table of Contents</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="29EBC66D" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:pStyle w:val="Heading2"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_Toc518041030" w:id="98"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>What if I’m doing research with devices?</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="98"/>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="55281C89" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>The FDA regulations place additional requirements on the IRB for the review of studies using medical devices. Before reviewing research involving devices, the IRB must identify and evaluate the regulatory status of the device study such as:</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="7EDBA4E8" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="41"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Whether the device study qualifies as a Non-Significant Risk (NSR) IDE study,</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="4B52631F" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="41"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Whether the device study qualifies as a Significant Risk (SR) IDE study, or</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="32B18C6E" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="41"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Whether the research use of the device is exempt from the IDE regulations.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="60652E94" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>If you believe the device is NSR IDE and the IRB agrees, then the IRB may go on to review the research. If the IRB disagrees and finds the study to be SR IDE and there is no FDA IDE exempt determination is provided, the IRB will provide the investigator and/or sponsor with that finding. The sponsor is responsible for notifying the FDA of the IRB’s SR IDE determination. The IRB will not review the research until the sponsor provides written proof that either:</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="24B8BCB5" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="32"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>The FDA has granted an IDE to the sponsor, or</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="5E2C3688" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="32"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>The FDA disagrees with the IRB’s SR IDE determination and has determined that the device is NSR IDE</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="6134E3E2" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>If the FDA has not responded to an IDE application, as described in FDA 21 CFR 812.30, this proof may consist of a letter showing than an IDE application was acknowledged by the FDA at least 30 days prior to the date on which the submission was forwarded to the IRB.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="45174532" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>If the research is SR IDE, provide the IRB with proof of the IDE number at the time of submission. In most cases, submitters should ensure the IRB receives a copy of the IDE letter that has not been redacted. Redacted IDE letters generally do not provide sufficient information for the IRB.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="28C65ED1" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>If a participant in the study must undergo a medical procedure as a part of the study, and that medical procedure is not one which the participant would otherwise undergo as part of standard medical care, the IRB must consider the risks associated with the procedure as well as the use of the device. If potential harm to subjects could be life-threatening, could result in permanent impairment of body function, or permanent damage to body structure, the device should be considered SR IDE.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="5D302E9F" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>If approved devices will be used as part of the research you may be asked to confirm that the devices will be used within their approved labeling.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="1C797A88" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">If your protocol involves the use of a device review “WORKSHEET: Devices (HRP-307)” and “Appendix A-2: Additional Requirements for FDA-Regulated Research” of this Manual to ensure you have provided sufficient information.  </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="7B5E750A" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Submission requirements for device research include providing a device manual (also called “Instructions for Use”) and ONE of the following:</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="71BD0554" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="21"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Unredacted FDA Letter granting the Investigational Device Exemption (IDE);* OR</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="7B825BBA" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="21"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Letter from sponsor stating that the study is a non-significant risk IDE device study and the basis for that determination;* (unredacted); OR</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="5305E448" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="21"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Documentation of why the investigation is exempt from the IDE requirements under 21 CFR § 812.2(c) (such as the PMA approval letter/number or 510(k) clearance letter/number) or otherwise exempt.*</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="007C04DF" w14:paraId="241385C9" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:hyperlink w:anchor="1fob9te">
                <w:r w:rsidR="00124C66">
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>Return to Table of Contents</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="1C002B84" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:pStyle w:val="Heading2"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_Toc518041031" w:id="99"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>What if I want to use a Humanitarian Use Device?</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="99"/>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="4D9222F8" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Humanitarian Use Devices have been granted a special exemption by the FDA known as a Humanitarian Device Exemption (HDE). The expected market for HUDs is so small that studies needed for full FDA approval would never be able to be carried out.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="7A5470E3" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:pStyle w:val="Heading3"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_3vac5uf" w:colFirst="0" w:colLast="0" w:id="100"/>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_Toc518041032" w:id="101"/>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="100"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>1. Using an HUD for its Approved Indication</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="101"/>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="147BAAC8" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>The use of an HUD for its approved indication does not constitute “research”; however, IRB review and approval is required by FDA regulations before an HUD may be used at a facility.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="675366F0" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>So long as you intend to use the HUD for clinical care within its approved indication, you should review the “WORKSHEET: Criteria for Approval for HUD Use in Clinical Care (HRP-323)” and submit in ETHOS.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="05A0EC71" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>As the use of an HUD for its approved indication is not considered “research”, the IRB’s education requirement, as well as the requirement for independent scientific assessment of the protocol and for the use of a research-specific HIPAA authorization form, are waived.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="099B6A12" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">The patient information booklet must be included in the ETHOS submission. This patient information booklet should make clear that the physician believes this device might work better than standard therapy but that it has not been tested in the usual way for full FDA approval the way most devices are since its use is rare. </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00B12638" w14:paraId="2A40DECD" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="15B02309" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">As the use of a HUD for clinical care is not research, and the HUD is a legally marketed device, the IRB does not make a significant risk or non-significant risk determination.  Continuing review may take place via expedited review or by review of the full convened committee. </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="213CCB77" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:pStyle w:val="Heading3"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_2afmg28" w:colFirst="0" w:colLast="0" w:id="102"/>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_Toc518041033" w:id="103"/>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="102"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>2. Using and HUD beyond its Approved Indication (Investigational Use)</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="103"/>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="34565ABD" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">Clinical investigation of an HUD beyond its approved indication requires an approved Investigational Device Exemption (IDE). Physicians may collect safety and effectiveness data to support a Pre-Market Approval (PMA) for the HDE-approved indication without an IDE as long as the HUD is used in accordance with its approved indication. </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="6FE3DB93" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>If the HUD is being used in the context of a clinical investigation, a completed IRB application is required, to include a research-specific HIPAA Authorization. All University and IRB investigational device-related policies and procedures apply to an HUD that is being used in the context of a clinical investigation.  Review the “WORKSHEET: Devices (HRP-307)” to ensure you have provided sufficient information.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="136B8B38" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>See FDA guidance titled “Guidance for HDE Holders, Institutional Review Boards (IRBs), Clinical Investigators, and Food and Drug Administration Staff Humanitarian Device Exemption (HDE) Regulation: Questions and Answers” for more information about requirements for use of HUDs.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="007C04DF" w14:paraId="1FC89DB7" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:hyperlink w:anchor="1fob9te">
                <w:r w:rsidR="00124C66">
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>Return to Table of Contents</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="6E573C0F" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:pStyle w:val="Heading2"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_Toc518041034" w:id="104"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>What if I am the sponsor or sponsor-investigator of an IND or IDE?</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="104"/>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="23A80FB3" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">You are required to follow FDA regulations that apply to your research. </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="016F106F" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">If you are employed by the University of Minnesota you are also required to follow the requirements in the policy Reporting Sponsor-Investigator IND/IDE and FDA Pre-Submissions https://policy.umn.edu/research/indide. </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="1CD633F7" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">Direct questions about any of these requirements to </w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:hyperlink r:id="rId89">
                <w:r>
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>medreg@umn.edu</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="609442B4" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>You are also required to comply with ICH GCP for drugs, biologics and as applicable to devices.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="32CFCCAB" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>The IRB complies with International Council for Harmonisation Good Clinical Practice E6 (ICH-GCP E6) guidelines for all research to the extent that they are compatible with FDA and DHHS regulations.  The IRB will comply with ICH-GCP E6 in one or both of the following circumstances:</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="68EB9309" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
                <w:ind w:left="720" w:hanging="360"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>1.</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:r>
                <w:tab/>
                <w:t>PI indicates the sponsor requires following ICH-GCP E6 standards; and/or</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="3074B516" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
                <w:ind w:left="720" w:hanging="360"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>2.</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:r>
                <w:tab/>
                <w:t>Sponsored Projects Administration (SPA) confirms it is a contractual requirement to follow ICH-GCP E6 standards.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="0853C74A" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Review “Appendix A-3: Additional Requirements for Clinical Trials (ICH-GCP)” in this Manual for additional study requirements and investigator responsibilities specific to these studies.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="007C04DF" w14:paraId="11112180" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:hyperlink w:anchor="1fob9te">
                <w:r w:rsidR="00124C66">
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>Return to Table of Contents</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="593EE724" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:pStyle w:val="Heading2"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_Toc518041035" w:id="105"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>What if I need expanded access to investigational drugs, biologics, and devices?</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="105"/>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="5D364065" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">FDA has set up several methods to access investigational drugs, biologics, and devices.  The agency has outlined those methods for Expanded Access (Compassionate Use) here: </w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:hyperlink r:id="rId90">
                <w:r>
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>https://www.fda.gov/NewsEvents/PublicHealthFocus/ExpandedAccessCompassionateUse/default.htm</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="05514740" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">The table below outlines the submission processes for each category of expanded and emergency use access of drugs and devices. </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="1A270C96" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:pStyle w:val="Heading3"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_1opuj5n" w:colFirst="0" w:colLast="0" w:id="106"/>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_Toc518041036" w:id="107"/>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="106"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Expanded Access (including Emergency Use) IRB Application Quick Reference Guide</w:t>
            </w:r>

                        <w:r>

                                <w:rFonts w:ascii="Times New Roman" w:hAnsi="Times New Roman" w:eastAsia="Times New Roman" w:cs="Times New Roman"/>
                            </w:rPr>
                            <w:t>Documented approval from the study sponsor, medical monitor and other oversight entities (e.g. FDA for studies under an IND or IDE held by a University sponsor) as applicable;</w:t>
                        </w:r>
                    </w:p>
                    <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="4E5DD3A5" w14:textId="77777777">
                        <w:pPr>

                            <w:rPr>

                            </w:rPr>
                        </w:pPr>

                            </w:rPr>
                            <w:t>A description of the requested exception including references to the approved protocol, proposed date, rationale, clarification as to why the change/action is one time and any plans for communicating the exception to the participant;</w:t>
                        </w:r>

            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
                <w:ind w:left="720" w:hanging="360"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>3.</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:r>
                <w:tab/>
                <w:t>Documentation of FDA IND Number, if available; if not available, indicate when the submission to the FDA was done</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="4388614C" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
                <w:ind w:left="720" w:hanging="360"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>4.</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:r>
                <w:tab/>
                <w:t>IB or supporting literature</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="62097B7F" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
                <w:ind w:left="720" w:hanging="360"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>5.</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:r>
                <w:tab/>
                <w:t>CV for the treating physician</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="20D39DA4" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
                <w:ind w:left="720" w:hanging="360"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>6.</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:r>
                <w:tab/>
                <w:t>Medical license for the treating physician</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="715362A2" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>If, after submitting the requested information, the patient’s condition changes such that he/she no longer needs approval of the single patient expanded access request notify the IRB as soon as possible.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="26FBDAB0" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>DEVICE – FDA guidance regarding access to investigational devices for treatment use (prior to use):</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="270152E7" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">FDA has provided guidance on expanded access for medical devices at </w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:hyperlink r:id="rId99">
                <w:r>
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>https://www.fda.gov/MedicalDevices/DeviceRegulationandGuidance/HowtoMarketYourDevice/InvestigationalDeviceExemptionIDE/ucm051345.htm</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="78D62DE6" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>The following requirements are taken from the Compassionate Use section of that page.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="4BABC36B" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Submission requirements prior to use of a device:</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="1774CB3F" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>To request a review and IRB Chair concurrence for the compassionate use of a device, the following information must be submitted:</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="76A5EE86" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
                <w:ind w:left="720" w:hanging="360"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>1.</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:r>
                <w:tab/>
                <w:t>Second opinion from an independent physician</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="56BC8530" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
                <w:ind w:left="720" w:hanging="360"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>2.</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:r>
                <w:tab/>
                <w:t>Documentation that the situation meets all criteria outlined in SOPs and worksheets</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="194E5BAE" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
                <w:ind w:left="720" w:hanging="360"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>3.</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:r>
                <w:tab/>
                <w:t>Documentation that will be submitted to the FDA for an IDE approval</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="6E1FE27F" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>See also:</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="58411C7E" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="15"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>“SOP: All Emergency Use and Compassionate Use Review (HRP-023)”</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="54EEFF70" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="15"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>“SOP: All Emergency Use and Compassionate Use Post-Review (HRP-027)”</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="6FCA5A94" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="15"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>“WORKSHEET: Device Compassionate Use (HRP-325)”</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="4101D960" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="15"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>“Emergency Use Consent Template (HRP-506)”</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="007C04DF" w14:paraId="7EFD0A38" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:hyperlink w:anchor="1fob9te">
                <w:r w:rsidR="00124C66">
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>Return to Table of Contents</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="4C7DF816" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:pStyle w:val="Heading2"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_Toc518041037" w:id="112"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>What if I need to report the emergency use of an investigational drug, biologic, or device (including emergency use of an HUD)?</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="112"/>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="17A333A5" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>These instructions apply to required report of emergency post-use of an investigational drug, biological product, or a device with a human subject under these circumstances: a life threatening situation, no standard acceptable treatment is available, and there was not sufficient time to obtain IRB approval.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="6B00F7A3" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">Instructions:  Use the following format for a proposed emergency use submission and send it via e-mail as instructed below.  </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="1F2918FC" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
                <w:ind w:left="720" w:hanging="720"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>1.</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:r>
                <w:tab/>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">Confirm in the e-mail that the circumstances meet the following criteria for emergency use:  </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="06B03D43" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
                <w:ind w:left="1440" w:hanging="720"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>a)</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:r>
                <w:tab/>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">The patient is confronted by a disease or condition that is life-threatening or severely debilitating, or the patient is confronted by a life-threatening disease or a serious condition requiring immediate use of an unapproved device.  </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="322AF248" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
                <w:ind w:firstLine="720"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>b)</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:r>
                <w:tab/>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">The situation necessitates the use of the test article (drug, biologic, device).    </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="349D7DD0" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
                <w:ind w:firstLine="720"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>c)</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:r>
                <w:tab/>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">No generally acceptable alternative for treating the patient is available. </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="18F05D3F" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
                <w:ind w:firstLine="720"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>d)</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:r>
                <w:tab/>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">There is insufficient time to obtain IRB approval.  </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="5835F4B4" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">Note:  The above findings for emergency use must also be noted in the medical record.  </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="28F98DC9" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>2.</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:r>
                <w:tab/>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">Attach the following materials to the e-mail as supporting documentation: </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="08C11D2F" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
                <w:ind w:left="1440" w:hanging="720"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>a)</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:r>
                <w:tab/>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">Document or e-mail that describes the patient's medical condition and the reason for the use of the test article.  (Do not include any identifiers in documents.) </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="73893A49" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
                <w:ind w:left="1440" w:hanging="720"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>b)</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:r>
                <w:tab/>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">Correspondence to and from the FDA with the investigational new drug (IND) number or investigational device exemption (IDE) number, if available.  </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="728DF4C8" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
                <w:ind w:firstLine="720"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>c)</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:r>
                <w:tab/>
                <w:t>All other FDA correspondence related to this emergency use.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="4AF49D02" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
                <w:ind w:firstLine="720"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>d)</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:r>
                <w:tab/>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">Authorization from the sponsor regarding use of the test article </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="25383569" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
                <w:ind w:firstLine="720"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>e)</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:r>
                <w:tab/>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">Protocol or detailed treatment plan for this patient </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="7865D542" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
                <w:ind w:firstLine="720"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>f)</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:r>
                <w:tab/>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">Investigator’s Brochure or drug package insert, or device information </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="75B33631" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
                <w:ind w:left="1440" w:hanging="720"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>g)</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:r>
                <w:tab/>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">Emergency use consent form to be used (Use “Emergency Use Consent Template (HRP-506).”) </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="7732E152" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
                <w:ind w:left="720" w:hanging="720"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>3.</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:r>
                <w:tab/>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">Send the e-mail and all subsequent communications (including the 5 day report) about the emergency use to: </w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:hyperlink r:id="rId100">
                <w:r>
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>irb@umn.edu</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">, copy </w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:hyperlink r:id="rId101">
                <w:r>
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>medreg@umn.edu</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>, and copy other persons involved in coordinating the use.  Once the IRB application number is assigned, it must be referenced on all correspondence.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="75FAF9CD" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
                <w:ind w:left="720" w:hanging="720"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>4.</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:r>
                <w:tab/>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">Keep the IRB informed about the status of a proposed use to proceed or if circumstances change.   </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="384E26C8" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
                <w:ind w:left="720" w:hanging="720"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>5.</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:r>
                <w:tab/>
                <w:t>By close of business within 5 days after the use of the device or first administration of the drug/biologic:</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="2932A37E" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
