                </w:rPr>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:color w:val="000000"/>
                </w:rPr>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">When an external IRB is serving as the IRB of record for the study, see </w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:hyperlink w:anchor="_thw4kt">
                <w:r>
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000CC"/>
                        <w:sz w:val="22"/>
                        <w:szCs w:val="22"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>What do I submit to the University of Minnesota IRB after my study is approved for reliance on an External IRB?</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00B12638" w14:paraId="0BEDC60E" w14:textId="77777777"/>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="3BD3D0BE" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:pStyle w:val="Heading2"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_Toc518041061" w:id="139"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>How do I submit Reportable New Information?</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="139"/>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="47FBD1B4" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">Complete the Report New Information (RNI) form in ETHOS, making sure to provide enough details for the IRB to understand the issue being reported. If the new information is specific to a particular study, report that information from with the Study Workspace so that an association will be made automatically between the report and the study itself. </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="22A8C793" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>If a Reportable New Information item requires revisions to study materials (i.e. informed consent document) and this modification is still in progress, include a comment in the RNI submission. If the modification related to the RNI is ready for IRB review, submit these changes using the Modification submission process and include a comment that this modification is related to an RNI submission and include the RNI ETHOS ID Number in the comment for easy reference.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="007C04DF" w14:paraId="3FFD1C6F" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:hyperlink w:anchor="1fob9te">
                <w:r w:rsidR="00124C66">
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>Return to Table of Contents</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="6C38937B" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:pStyle w:val="Heading2"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_Toc518041062" w:id="140"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>What must be reported at the time of Continuing Review?</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="140"/>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="517EC89F" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:r>
                <w:t>The continuing review form will prompt investigators to provide information regarding the progress of the study. When completing this form, you will be required to specify enrollment totals. Enrollment is defined as eligible, appropriately informed individuals agreeing to participate in a study who have signed the informed consent. For data and/or specimen only protocols, this number should reflect the total number of data and/or specimens accessed for research purposes. This number should not exceed the total number of subjects requested in the approved protocol. If you wish to request additional subjects, a modification should be submitted for review.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="07E36E2E" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve"> </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="3B069C33" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:i/>
                    <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                    <w:u w:val="single"/>
                </w:rPr>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">For more information about what is asked for in this form, see </w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:r>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                    <w:u w:val="single"/>
                </w:rPr>
                <w:t>How do I submit continuing review?</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00B12638" w14:paraId="07A320EE" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:i/>
                    <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                    <w:u w:val="single"/>
                </w:rPr>
            </w:pPr>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="1832FA1E" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Effective March 27, 2017, submitting logs of events at continuing review is not required. Logs of events that occurred prior to validation of pre-ETHOS approved studies need not be submitted to the University of Minnesota IRB.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00B12638" w14:paraId="76B21874" w14:textId="77777777"/>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="296105E4" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:pStyle w:val="Heading2"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_Toc518041063" w:id="141"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Do I submit clinical research monitoring reports to the IRB?</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="141"/>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="0A2BB71A" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">Effective October 1, 2017, written reports of study monitors will require central filing with the Post Approval Review (PAR) program of the HRPP and no longer require mandatory submission to the IRB. This change is being carried out in light of the full migration of all clinical research protocols to ETHOS and aligns with planned global changes described in the Advancing Human Research Protections </w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:hyperlink r:id="rId113">
                <w:r>
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>Final Monitoring Report</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="4A1C078F" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Investigators are required to submit promptly reportable events to the IRB within five business days of discovery of the event. Occasionally, such events are identified during clinical monitoring and, as such, must be reported to the IRB accordingly.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="305ACBBF" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">To submit monitoring reports to PAR, complete this </w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:hyperlink r:id="rId114">
                <w:r>
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>form</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>. You'll be asked to attach the monitoring report to the form.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="007C04DF" w14:paraId="26472D37" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:hyperlink w:anchor="1fob9te">
                <w:r w:rsidR="00124C66">
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>Return to Table of Contents</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="139E4DC2" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:pStyle w:val="Heading2"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_Toc518041064" w:id="142"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>What should I do if I receive a complaint or concern about my study?</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="142"/>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="3B19B67C" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">You should make a good faith effort to promptly respond to – and try to resolve – any study-related complaint or concern that you receive or of which you are aware. </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="647A96ED" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">If the item is significant, you are also required to promptly report the complaint or concern to the IRB. See “How do I submit Reportable New Information” for instructions on prompt reporting to the IRB. An item is considered significant if </w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:r>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:u w:val="single"/>
                </w:rPr>
                <w:t>any</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve"> of the following are true:</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="4DFCE0CE" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="14"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">It may adversely impact a participant’s or a potential participant’s safety, rights or welfare. </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="79492F73" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="14"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>It requires a change to the study protocol or consent form.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="07AE4F35" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="14"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">It remains unresolved despite a good faith effort by the researcher to resolve it. </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="4521649E" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="14"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">It involves noncompliance or an allegation of noncompliance. See </w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:hyperlink r:id="rId115">
                <w:r>
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>HRP-001-SOP: Definitions</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve"> for the definition of “noncompliance”.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="2D1DDC5D" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="14"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Reporting has been requested by the Post Approval Review team related to an item submitted directly to the HRPP. See “What happens when the HRPP receives complaints or concerns directly?” for more information.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="6D9BA2E4" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>It is understood that some complaints and concerns that you receive are relatively minor (e.g., a participant complaint about a late payment that can be quickly resolved). One time, minor complaints that can be quickly resolved generally do not require reporting to the IRB.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="007C04DF" w14:paraId="06C4ED22" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:hyperlink w:anchor="1fob9te">
                <w:r w:rsidR="00124C66">
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>Return to Table of Contents</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="4BC9DED5" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:pStyle w:val="Heading2"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_Toc518041065" w:id="143"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>What happens when the HRPP receives complaints or concerns directly?</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="143"/>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="1A767509" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:color w:val="333333"/>
                    <w:highlight w:val="white"/>
                </w:rPr>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:color w:val="333333"/>
                    <w:highlight w:val="white"/>
                </w:rPr>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">The HRPP is concerned about the safety, rights, and welfare of all individuals participating in research at UMN and its affiliated sites. All concerns and complaints are taken seriously. </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="4D74A413" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:color w:val="353A3F"/>
                </w:rPr>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:color w:val="333333"/>
                    <w:highlight w:val="white"/>
                </w:rPr>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">Complaints or concerns may be </w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:hyperlink r:id="rId116">
                <w:r>
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:highlight w:val="white"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>submitted directly to the HRPP</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
            <w:r>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:color w:val="333333"/>
                    <w:highlight w:val="white"/>
                </w:rPr>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve"> by anyone, including research participants, family members and representatives, and study team members</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:r>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:b/>
                    <w:color w:val="333333"/>
                    <w:highlight w:val="white"/>
                </w:rPr>
                <w:t>.</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:r>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:color w:val="333333"/>
                    <w:highlight w:val="white"/>
                </w:rPr>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve"> The HRPP is </w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:r>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:color w:val="353A3F"/>
                </w:rPr>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">required </w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>to respond to all concerns and complaints received.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="0EC74386" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:color w:val="353A3F"/>
                </w:rPr>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:color w:val="353A3F"/>
                </w:rPr>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">The </w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:hyperlink r:id="rId117">
                <w:r>
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>Post Approval Review program</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
            <w:r>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:color w:val="353A3F"/>
                </w:rPr>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve"> will attempt to resolve minor concerns or complaints with the complainant, if appropriate. This may include referring the participant to the study team. </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00B12638" w14:paraId="0D761E42" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:color w:val="353A3F"/>
                    <w:sz w:val="16"/>
                    <w:szCs w:val="16"/>
                </w:rPr>
            </w:pPr>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="077394C2" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:color w:val="353A3F"/>
                </w:rPr>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:color w:val="353A3F"/>
                </w:rPr>
                <w:t>If the item is judged to be significant, or if it cannot be resolved easily, additional actions will be taken. This often includes requesting that the researcher report the item to the IRB as Reportable New Information.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="007C04DF" w14:paraId="781E9497" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:hyperlink w:anchor="1fob9te">
                <w:r w:rsidR="00124C66">
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>Return to Table of Contents</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="483754F3" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:pStyle w:val="Heading2"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_Toc518041066" w:id="144"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>What if my Human Research is suspended or terminated?</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="144"/>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="0DC2BDEE" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>If the IRB suspends or terminates your Human Research, the IRB will provide a statement of the reasons for suspension or termination.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="02FD0A2A" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="19"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>For suspension, the IRB will indicate whether some or all of the Human Research has been suspended. If, for example, the suspension applies only to the enrollment of new participants, the IRB will indicate so.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="407B914C" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="19"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>For termination, you must immediately cease all research activities and work with the IRB to develop a plan for safely removing participants from the research.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="5F81F89C" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="19"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">If you disagree with the IRB’s decision to suspend or terminate your Human Research, you may request reconsideration of that decision in the same way as you would any other IRBs decision to disapprove a submission. See the </w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:hyperlink w:anchor="_3dhjn8m">
                <w:r>
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>What if I disagree with the IRB’s decision?</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve"> section above. </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="007C04DF" w14:paraId="182B6E03" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:hyperlink w:anchor="1fob9te">
                <w:r w:rsidR="00124C66">
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>Return to Table of Contents</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="55282DCC" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:pStyle w:val="Heading2"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_Toc518041067" w:id="145"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>What reporting obligations does the IRB have?</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="145"/>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="0171DA9B" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:after="300" w:line="276" w:lineRule="auto"/>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:highlight w:val="white"/>
                </w:rPr>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:highlight w:val="white"/>
                </w:rPr>
                <w:t>HHS regulations at 45 CFR 46.103(a) and (b)(5) and FDA regulations at 21 CFR 56.108(b) require that institutions have written procedures to ensure that the following determinations are promptly reported:</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="07DC2A94" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="77"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:contextualSpacing/>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:b/>
                    <w:highlight w:val="white"/>
                </w:rPr>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:b/>
                    <w:highlight w:val="white"/>
                </w:rPr>
                <w:t>Any unanticipated problems involving risks to subjects or others (UPIRTSO);</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="245A2112" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="77"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:contextualSpacing/>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:b/>
                    <w:highlight w:val="white"/>
                </w:rPr>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:b/>
                    <w:highlight w:val="white"/>
                </w:rPr>
                <w:t>Any serious or continuing noncompliance with FDA or OHRP regulations or the requirements or determinations of the IRB; and</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="30B38273" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="77"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:contextualSpacing/>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:b/>
                    <w:highlight w:val="white"/>
                </w:rPr>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:b/>
                    <w:highlight w:val="white"/>
                </w:rPr>
                <w:t>Any suspension or termination of IRB approval.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="71A03BDF" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:after="160"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>The investigator is notified of these determinations in writing.  In addition, the following officials and entities are notified: Department Head, Dean, Institutional Officials, HRPP Quality Assurance Program, and, when applicable, research partners (e.g. Fairview Research Administration or Gillette).</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="2B25C426" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:after="160"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>When reporting to regulatory entities (e.g. FDA and/or OHRP) is required, the IRB will make every effort to notify the investigator in writing, by phone, or in person prior to forwarding the report to the regulatory entity.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="62E2B7D9" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:after="160"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>See “SOP: Post Review (HRP-052)” for information regarding the IRB’s obligations to report information to regulatory and university officials and department leadership.  In addition, see “Template: External Report (HRP-520)” for information regarding template language to be included in the external report to the regulatory entity.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00B12638" w14:paraId="2EB3FC11" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="007C04DF" w14:paraId="49D9D1CC" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:hyperlink w:anchor="1fob9te">
                <w:r w:rsidR="00124C66">
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>Return to Table of Contents</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="44524CBC" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:pStyle w:val="Heading2"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_Toc518041068" w:id="146"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>What if I need access to IRB records or rosters?</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="146"/>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="2456A908" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Investigators are responsible for maintaining complete study files. All IRB related study documents are located in ETHOS. Historical studies (non-ETHOS) if needed, can be requested. Information from the IRB Roster, HRP-601, is available upon request.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="007C04DF" w14:paraId="2B9F5E7E" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:hyperlink w:anchor="1fob9te">
                <w:r w:rsidR="00124C66">
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>Return to Table of Contents</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="1BF8BF4C" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:pStyle w:val="Heading2"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_Toc518041069" w:id="147"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>What if I need institutional certification for NIH Genomic Data Sharing?</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="147"/>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="30CF90F1" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>To request institutional certification for NIH Genomic Data Sharing (NIH GDS), submit a Modification for the study in ETHOS. When submitting this modification request, select “Other parts of the study.”  Include the request in the Modification Summary and submit any documentation in the Supporting Documents section.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="25F82839" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>For additional information on this process see:</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="3C2BCECD" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="61"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>“SOP: NIH GDS Institutional Certification (HRP-064)”</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="77A95BDF" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="61"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>“WORKSHEET: NIH GDS Institutional Certification (HRP-332)”</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="37366C34" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="61"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>“TEMPLATE LETTER: NIH GDS Institutional Certification (HRP-528)”</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="007C04DF" w14:paraId="3DE1D9D6" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:hyperlink w:anchor="1fob9te">
                <w:r w:rsidR="00124C66">
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>Return to Table of Contents</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="1C6EC382" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:pStyle w:val="Heading2"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_Toc518041070" w:id="148"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>How do I close out a study?</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="148"/>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="604F00C1" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Researchers are required to submit final closeout reports when a study is permanently closed to enrollment, participants have completed all research activities, and the collection and primary analysis, as defined in the protocol and approved by the IRB, of identifiable information is complete.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="51DCE499" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Complete the Continuing Review SmartForm in ETHOS and attach all requested supplements, and have the PI submit the form by clicking the “Submit” activity.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="223A9E6C" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>If you fail to submit a continuing review form to close out Human Research, you will be restricted from submitting new Human Research until the completed form has been received.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="3DDC4ABC" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>If the continuing review form for closing out a Human Research study is not received by the date requested in the approval letter, you will be restricted from submitting new Human Research until the completed application is received.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="007C04DF" w14:paraId="472BDC4C" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:hyperlink w:anchor="1fob9te">
                <w:r w:rsidR="00124C66">
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>Return to Table of Contents</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="78AF2CD1" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:pStyle w:val="Heading2"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_Toc518041071" w:id="149"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>How long do I keep records?</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="149"/>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="73574CA0" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Investigators must maintain records according to the longest requirements that apply:</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="77239C52" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">Maintain your Human Research records, including signed and dated consent documents for at least three years after completion of the research. </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="2C30DBEB" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Maintain signed and dated HIPAA authorizations and consent documents that include HIPAA authorizations for at least six years after completion of the research.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="69719006" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>For drug studies conducted under an IND, keep records for two years following the date a marketing application is approved for the drug for the indication for which it is being investigated; or, if no application is to be filed or if the application is not approved for such indication, until two years after the investigation is discontinued and FDA is notified.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="44AF2539" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>For device studies conducted under an IDE or abbreviated IDE, keep records for two years after the latter of the following two dates: The date on which the investigation is terminated or completed, or the date that the records are no longer required for purposes of supporting a premarket approval application or a notice of completion of a product development protocol.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="0E33DCE4" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>If your Human Research is sponsored contact the sponsor before disposing of Human Research records.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="007C04DF" w14:paraId="76ADE0DB" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:hyperlink w:anchor="1fob9te">
                <w:r w:rsidR="00124C66">
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>Return to Table of Contents</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="07981D16" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:r>
                <w:br w:type="page"/>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="71A07B47" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:pStyle w:val="Heading1"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_Toc518041072" w:id="150"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>IRB Reliance Guidance: Serving as the Single IRB of Record and External IRB Review of Human Research</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="150"/>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="34A64C07" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:pStyle w:val="Heading2"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_Toc518041073" w:id="151"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>What if I want the University of Minnesota IRB to Serve as IRB of Record for a Multi-Site or Collaborative Study?</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="151"/>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="6ABF7E7C" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">The University of Minnesota IRB will not serve as the IRB of record for a </w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:r>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:u w:val="single"/>
                </w:rPr>
                <w:t>Multi-Site Study</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve"> or </w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:r>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:u w:val="single"/>
                </w:rPr>
                <w:t>Collaborative Study</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">. This means that other external institutions/sites or external collaborators engaged in </w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:r>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:u w:val="single"/>
                </w:rPr>
                <w:t>Human Research</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve"> cannot rely on the University’s IRB for IRB review at this time.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="007C04DF" w14:paraId="4F6441FF" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:hyperlink w:anchor="1fob9te">
                <w:r w:rsidR="00124C66">
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>Return to Table of Contents</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="5444C381" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:pStyle w:val="Heading2"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_Toc518041074" w:id="152"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Will the University’s IRB serve as the IRB of Record for the NIH Single IRB Review Policy?</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="152"/>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="6D0D0CF8" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">The University of Minnesota IRB will not, at this time, serve as the IRB of Record for any </w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:r>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:u w:val="single"/>
                </w:rPr>
                <w:t>Single IRB (sIRB) Study</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve"> to which the NIH Single IRB Review policy applies. This may change in the future. For now, when the U of M will be the lead site submitting an NIH grant application and the U of M PI needs assistance identifying an IRB to perform sIRB review, Chesapeake IRB can be designated as the reviewing IRB (sIRB). Using Chesapeake IRB is not required if U of M is the lead site and another participating IRB agrees to serves as the sIRB. The HRPP office will also provide assistance with identifying options for who could serve as the reviewing IRB as well as provide a letter of support for grant applications. See the </w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:hyperlink r:id="rId118">
                <w:r>
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>NIH Single IRB webpage</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve"> for specific information about the NIH policy.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="007C04DF" w14:paraId="28B76F85" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:hyperlink w:anchor="1fob9te">
                <w:r w:rsidR="00124C66">
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>Return to Table of Contents</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="203E0AAC" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:pStyle w:val="Heading2"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_Toc518041075" w:id="153"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>What if I want to rely on an external IRB for the review of my study?</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="153"/>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="072C3BA9" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">Institutions across the nation refer to reliance in different ways. To learn more about commonly used terms and definitions; access “SOP: Definitions (HRP-001)” in the </w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:hyperlink r:id="rId119">
                <w:r>
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>HRPP Toolkit Library</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>. In general, “reliance” refers to the use of an IRB external to the University to conduct the regulatory review and oversight of a study. Reliance arrangements can be complex and the process to negotiate agreements can be lengthy. The HRPP is responsible for negotiating and coordinating the execution of IRB reliance agreements. This includes obtaining review by legal counsel, as needed, and signature of the University’s Institutional Official.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="46F96756" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">Relying on an external IRB requires both a </w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:r>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:u w:val="single"/>
                </w:rPr>
                <w:t>Reliance Agreement</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve"> covering your project as well as a submission in ETHOS. It is also important to keep in mind that external IRB review and oversight (“reliance”) is limited to the IRB regulatory review.  Human Research Protection components such as ancillary reviews, financial conflicts of interest review and management, research personnel training, and state law and institutional requirements remain the responsibility of the University of Minnesota. The external IRB (“reviewing IRB”) looks to the University of Minnesota to ensure those local requirements have been met. Many of these aspects must be completed prior to approval for reliance on an external IRB.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="007C04DF" w14:paraId="68FE16C5" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:hyperlink w:anchor="1fob9te">
                <w:r w:rsidR="00124C66">
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>Return to Table of Contents</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="76BC7D2C" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:pStyle w:val="Heading2"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_Toc518041076" w:id="154"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>How do I know if my study is eligible for reliance on an external IRB?</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="154"/>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="381AF99F" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">For new requests not under an </w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:hyperlink r:id="rId120">
                <w:r>
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:b/>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>existing Reliance Agreement</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>, investigators should contact the HRPP office to discuss the option to rely on an external IRB. Requests to rely on external IRB review and oversight are reviewed on a case-by-case basis. We encourage investigators to seek guidance as early as possible. If a reliance arrangement is possible, the process of executing an appropriate agreement can take significant time and many of the factors influencing timing are outside of the control of the local investigator and the HRPP.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="7DE70D51" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>While requests to rely on an external IRB are evaluated on a case-by-case basis, the HRPP developed criteria to assist in identifying whether your project may be eligible. Refer to “WORKSHEET: Criteria for External IRB Reliance (HRP-814)” for eligibility criteria for relying on an external IRB including the option to use Quorum Review IRB for multi-site business-and-industry-sponsored studies. For requests to rely on an external IRB that do not fall clearly within the criteria, a case-by-case assessment is conducted by the HRPP Reliance Administrator or designated staff with input from the Executive Director.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="007C04DF" w14:paraId="23F6E459" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:hyperlink w:anchor="1fob9te">
                <w:r w:rsidR="00124C66">
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>Return to Table of Contents</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="51A2F0FD" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:pStyle w:val="Heading2"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_Toc518041077" w:id="155"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>What is the process for requesting reliance on an external IRB?</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="155"/>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="7303FEC3" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">Refer to the </w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:hyperlink r:id="rId121">
                <w:r>
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>How to Submit Reliance Request IRB webpage</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve"> which includes an ETHOS External IRB Job Aid on the “How to Submit Reliance Request” </w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:hyperlink r:id="rId122">
                <w:r>
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>webpage</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve"> for a step-by-step guide.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="007C04DF" w14:paraId="7B516B68" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:hyperlink w:anchor="1fob9te">
                <w:r w:rsidR="00124C66">
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>Return to Table of Contents</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="7D927C9F" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:pStyle w:val="Heading2"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_Toc518041078" w:id="156"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>What is the process for requesting reliance on Quorum Review IRB for business-and-industry studies?</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="156"/>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="77C3EC19" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Quorum Review IRB is currently the only independent/commercial IRB that may be used for external IRB review for multi-site business-and industry-sponsored studies.  Using Quorum Review IRB for business-and industry-sponsored studies is optional. In addition to ensuring your study meet the criteria for use of Quorum Review IRB, you may also want to check if the study sponsor is using Quorum Review as its designated reviewing IRB (central IRB) or if your site will be considered a “single-site” submission. The study may be subject to additional requirements as noted by Quorum Review IRB.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="32458387" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="39"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">Reference the reliance agreement criteria in HRP-814: Worksheet – Criteria for External IRB Reliance to determine eligibility for your project. </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="2FD3A30B" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:numPr>
                    <w:ilvl w:val="0"/>
                    <w:numId w:val="39"/>
                </w:numPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve">Reference the ETHOS External IRB Job Aid on the “How to Submit Reliance Request-Quorum” </w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:hyperlink r:id="rId123">
                <w:r>
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>webpage</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
            <w:r>
                <w:t xml:space="preserve"> for a step-by-step guide.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="65229E08" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Questions about fees, process for submitting to Quorum and IRB review must be directed to the Quorum account manager designated for the University of Minnesota.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>

            <w:bookmarkStart w:name="_Toc518041079" w:id="157"/>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Does a study team using an External IRB use the U of M consent template?</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="157"/>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="65684AD0" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>If you rely on an external IRB as the IRB of record, the study sponsor or lead site will most likely provide a template consent form. You will need to revise this template consent to incorporate University of Minnesota HRPP requirements. The University of Minnesota HRPP developed standardized language (</w:t>
            </w:r>
            <w:hyperlink r:id="rId124">
                <w:r>
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>HRP-542a - Quorum IRB Review standard language, HRP-542b - Advarra standard language, HRP-542c - Other external IRB</w:t>
                </w:r>
            </w:hyperlink>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>) to incorporate into the sponsor or study template consent form, as applicable.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="007C04DF" w14:paraId="6D0AF603" w14:textId="77777777">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>

                <w:r w:rsidR="00124C66">
                    <w:rPr>
                        <w:color w:val="0000FF"/>
                        <w:u w:val="single"/>
                    </w:rPr>
                    <w:t>Return to Table of Contents</w:t>
                </w:r>

            <w:r>

            </w:r>

            </w:r>

            </w:pPr>

                <w:t xml:space="preserve">Approval Letter from the external IRB/IRB of record; </w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00B12638" w:rsidRDefault="00124C66" w14:paraId="4C8021A2" w14:textId="77777777">

            </w:r>

                <w:t>Last day of approval.</w:t>
            </w:r>
        </w:p>

                <w:spacing w:before="120" w:after="120"/>
            </w:pPr>

            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>

            </w:pPr>
            <w:r>
                <w:t>Audit, inspection, or inquiry by a federal agency within five days of the investigator learning of the inspection and any written reports from federal agencies (e.g., FDA Form 483)</w:t>
            </w:r>
